loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married, with three children between the ages of three months and eight years. She started a business because she did not go to school; her mother trained her to do business.

Hawa runs a general food commodities business. She sells palm oil, dried fish, and bread. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business throughout the week. She says that her business is doing well. 

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more food stock, like palm oil and dried fish. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food stock for her business, like palm oil and dried fish.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 20-year-old single young woman. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Maha's brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. She is a university student who wants to complete her studies. Maha's mother is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Maha is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. She will use her laptop to do her homework and papers and help in her studies. Her loan will ensure a better future for Maha and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop computer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 36 years old, married with 7 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community, to earn a living. She's been in this business for over 6 years and earns 7,000PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2010. Gina is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes and dreams for her children to have a better future and that they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Joeclyn is a 49 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 5,500 PHP every month.

Joeclyn joined GDMPC last year and is requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar to sell at her retail store. She hopes and dreams of being able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями в сельской местности. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес, который является самым распространенным среди сельского населения, то есть скотоводством. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации для себя и довольно, что обучилась на этом курсе. Она намерена срочно открыть свое дело, так как последние годы были для нее очень тяжелыми. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhayo is 24 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in a rural area. She would like to launch her own business of the type most common among the rural population--raising livestock. With this goal she has completed a “Reach for Success” courses organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate. She has learned much new information and is glad to have taken the course. She plans to launch her business right away as the past few years have been very hard for her. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to buy cattle. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for  launching her new business.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
AbdulRahman is a 27-year-old married young man who has two sons and one daughter. He is employed and earns small salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs. AbdulRahman is thinking of a way to raise his income in order to improve his family's living conditions and he is starting a transportation company. He is photographed  next to his new rickshaw.

AbdulRahman is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help purchase a new vehicle to begin a transportation business. His loan will offer him another source of income to help him provide for his family. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle to begin a transportation business

loans.name: Tamador

texts.en:
Tamador is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in his grocery store.

Tamador is a Palestinian woman. She is married and a mother to one son and three daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past two years, Tamador's husband has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable business and a second source of income for the family, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Tamador is requesting a USD 2,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request and buy, such as rice, sugar, canned food, and milk. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries for her husband's store.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Isata from Kandehtown Bo, a married mother of five children between the ages of 8 and 20 years, all currently attending school. She began her business because she wants to develop herself and the family.

For 10 years now, Isata has been operating a palm oil business, selling her product by the gallon. She works thoughout the week, and earns additional income from small-scale farming in the village. Isata says that her business is doing well, and she is acquiring new customers everyday.

Isata has requested a loan to buy more palm oil to resell. The extra income arising from this loan will allow her to improve her family status. In the future, she plans to open a food commodities store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22 year old single man from Al-Nusairat.  He has his own business which is to sell electrical home appliances.  His business earns him a good income, but not enough.  

He is looking to improve his home especially the bedroom, the bathroom and the kitchen.  He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.  His home will be improved and be ready so Mohammad and his future wife will live in it.  He is pictured in front of his home.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of improving his house

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 21-year-old single young woman. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online and her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo. Ola is a university student who wants to complete her studies. Her brother is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Ola is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. She will use her laptop to do her homework, write reports, and help her in her studies. Her loan will ensure a better future for Ola and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop computer

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Meet Abie, who is 34 years old and from Torkpoi town in the Bo Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children who are 14 and 18 years old. Abie's children are currently attending school. In 2004, she established a food market to raise income to support her household. She works eight hours per day and six days each week. Abie says that her business is doing well. 

Abie is requesting a loan to buy food containers and palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her business and help pay her children's school fees. In the future, Abie plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food containers and palm oil

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Bernadette from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 and 25. Two of her children are currently attending school. Bernadette runs a food business within a busy market area where she sells onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil, and gari. She has been running this business for 15 years and works 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. Bernadette says that that her business is doing well.

Bernadette is requesting a loan to buy more onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil and gari. The extra income from her loan will allow her to increase her business and feed her family. In the future, Bernadette plans to open a food store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy onions, pepper, Maggie, palm oil and gari

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 39 years old and married with five children between the ages of five and 20 years old. Four of her children attend school. Fatmata runs a store where she sells palm oil and beans in Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She started her business to help her husband take care of their family.  

Fatmata is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase shoes to sell at her store. She will use her loan to expand her business and hopes that her extra income will help her to provide food and shelter for her family. In the future, Fatmata would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell at her store

loans.name: Kema

texts.en:
Kema is 34 years old and married with four children between the ages of seven and 21. Three of her children go to school and she has one additional dependent at home. For the past eight years, Kema has run a food stand in Kandeh town, Bo Southern area in Sierra Leone where she sells palm oil, gari, and rice. She also receives income from her brother. Kema's main business challenges are the slow purchasing power of her customers and transportation costs.

Kema is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more general stock such as palm oil, rice, and gari. The extra income from her loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kema would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, and gari

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Meet Watta from Kulanda Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is 36 years old with three children and they all go to school. Watta runs a clothing store selling blouses, skirts and shirts. She works at her business 15 hours a day, 6 days a week.  

Watta requested the loan to purchase more clothing for her store to sell during the dry season. She says that her challenge is that during the rainy season, business is slow.  The loan will help her expand her business and educate her children. In five years, she wants to grow her business into a large store that sells all sorts of different items, not just clothes. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Esther B.

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Esther from Kandeh Town, Bo in Sierra Leone. She is a single parent with three children, between the ages of 3 and 18. She sells palm oil and bush meat 9 hours per day, 7 days per week at the market and along the highway. Esther decided to start her business when she was unable to further her education. She says that palm oil is getting more scarce but she has a good relationship with her old suppliers that will keep her well stocked.  

Esther has requested the loan to buy more stock to expand her business. The extra income will help her finish building her house and rent it out to generate more income for her family. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as palm oil and bush meat

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Princess from Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She is married with five adult children. Her husband is a retired worker. Princess operates a store selling assorted beverages, including fresh milk and soft drinks. She initially started her business to improve herself and her store sold local foodstuff such as gari and palm oil.   

Princess requested this loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more inventory for the expansion of her business. She says that her customer demand for her products is very strong but she does not have the capital to purchase sufficient stock. The extra income generated from the loan will help improve her standard of life. In the future, she hopes to own and operate more shops in the area. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as milk and soft drinks

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en: Meet 35-year-old Nenneh from Moriba Town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 13. One of her children currently attends school, and her husband is a teacher. She sells gari (processed cassava flour) and works every day at her business. She first started the business to improve herself and to take care of her children. The business is going well, and she is applying for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy more inventory to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from the loan will help give her the ability to take better care of her children and to take her business to another level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari (processed cassava flour), and expand her business.

loans.name: Animata

texts.en: Animata is 31 years old, married, and has three children, between the ages of 2 to 10. She runs a store in Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. Her business is open seven days a week. She sells mobile phones, clothes, coolers and food containers to hotels and offices in the area. She was inspired by her mother, a strong businesswoman, to enter into business. Her store is doing well, and she is now looking to expand. She applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more inventory for her business. Her goal is to grow her business to be one of the largest in her community in the next five years. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more inventory, such as mobile phones, clothes, coolers and food containers, for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Musu from Kandeh Town. She is widowed and has four children between the ages of 15 and 23. Musu runs a store where she sells palm oil, rice and gari (processed cassava flour). She works at the business throughout the week and has two employees working for her. Musu says that the business is going well and that she is looking to expand her business. She first started her business in order to educate her children. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living conditions and those of her family. In the future, she plans to continue to grow her shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy inventory, such as gari (processed cassava flour), palm oil and rice, to expand her business.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu is 39 years old, widowed, and has three children, ages 7 years to 15 years. She runs a food stand at Moriba Town in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She began her business because she need a permanent source of income to support her children. She has been in this business for the past 10 years, and she sells fish, onions, and rice in a busy market area. Storage is one of the big challenges she faces in her business. She applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food commodities, such as fish, cooking oil and rice. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support

loans.use: to buy food, such as fish, cooking oil and rice, for her food stand.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 28-year-old single young man. He is a construction worker who earns small salary which is not enough to cover all his expenses. Ashraf is engaged and is preparing to get married soon after finishing construction on his house. He is photographed in his new house.

Ashraf is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting and purchasing and installing new windows and doors to his house. His loan will enable him to finish his house and prepare himself well to soon get married.

loans.use: to cover the cost of painting and installing new windows and doors for his new house

loans.name: Frances B.

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Frances from Kandeh town in Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 10 and 24. Her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Frances established a palm oil business to create income to pay her children school fees. She works 14 hours per day, every day. Frances's main business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Frances is requesting a loan to buy more gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Frances plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Joshua S.

texts.en:
Meet 36 year-old Joshua from Kulanda Town, Bo, located in the southern part of Sierra Leone.  He is married with two children, ages 3 and 7.  Joshua's wife is a teacher who also contributes to support the family.  

Joshua runs a local convenience store where he sells assorted items. When he started his business, he only sold shoes but has now expanded to include many other items. Joshua also owns a moto-taxi to generate more income.  

Joshua is requesting a loan to purchase more goods and inventory for his store. He hopes that his loan will generate more income to take care of his family.  Your support is greatly appreciated!

loans.use: to purchase goods and inventory for his store

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene 21 años es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres junto a su abuela y sus 2 hermanos .José trabaja en la venta de prendas de vestir, principalmente  para varones aunque en ocasiones vende prendas para mujer  siempre y cuando sus clientes se lo soliciten , recibe la mercaderia desde Lima ya que un familiar suyo se lo provee. El sistema de ventas es crediticio y el cobro lo hace de manera  diaria, semanal o mensual previo acuerdo con su comprador. Vende directamente entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos .Asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar en la venta de prendas de vestir ya que tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos y machistas de las personas que le decían que ese es un trabajo femenino, sin embargo, ahora realiza su labor de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado, espera algún día establecer una tienda de ropas y por otra parte establecer con el paso del tiempo un centro de diseño gráfico en el que pueda desarrollar su vocación.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas ya que con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir masculinas como polos, pantalones y jeans.
texts.en:
José, 21, is single and has no children yet because he feels it is best to have your finances in order before starting a family. He lives in his parents' home with his grandmother and two brothers. José mainly sells men's clothing, though when his customers request it, he will sell women's clothes. A relative in Lima sends the merchandise to him. He offers his customers credit on daily, weekly, or monthly terms as agreed. He sells to relatives, friends, and neighbors. At first, selling clothing was difficult because he confronted negative comments that suggested this was work for women. Now, however, the business is going very well, and sales have increased. 

He hopes to have a clothing store one day and to establish a design workshop where he can pursue his vocation. He is applying for a loan of S/. 1000 soles and is grateful to those whose support will help him meet his objectives. He promises to make his payments on time. He will use the loan to buy men's clothing such as polo shirts, pants, and jeans.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing.

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 32-year-old young married man and a father to one son. Reyad is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs. Reyad and his family are suffering from the humidity in their house, which makes their house's living condition not healthy and not suitable to live in.

Reyad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary materials to fix the humidity in his house. This will enable Reyad and his family to enjoy living in suitable home conditions.

Reyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: To fix the humidity in the house

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años y esta casada con  Josue de 37 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ella Comparte junto a su familia una casa construida a base de Madera adquirida hace poco.Inicialmente como ama de casa al cuidado del primero de sus hijos apoyo la iniciativa de aperturar un negocio propio en el cual se dedican a la reparación de diversos vehículos.
Esta decisión fue muy sólida ya que en aquel entonces Josue se desempeñaba como ayudante en un taller particular y consideraba tener la capacidad de independizarse.
Llevan casi 15 años en este negocio y con el paso de los años han logrado consolidarse  y tener un buen sustento para el desarrollo de su familia ya que ella se encarga de administrar la tienda que posee en su taller donde expende diversos insumos para la reparación como aceites y repuestos , mientras que su esposo brinda el servicio técnico correspondiente.A manera de surtir nuevamente su negocio y contar con más variedad de productos desea contar con un capital de trabajo.Dentro de sus prioridades a largo plazo esta la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble para asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a su vez tener un mejor ambiente para su negocio.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP razón por la cual solicita 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y aceites para autos .
texts.en:
Esther, 36, lives with her husband Josué, 37, with whom she has three children.  She and her family share a house built of wood that they recently acquired.

Initially, as a housewife caring for her first child, she supported the initiative to open her own business in an auto-repair shop for different vehicles.  This was a very sound decision because at that time Josué was working as an assistant in a private shop and thought he had the ability to go out on his own.

They have had this business for almost 15 years.  Over time they have managed to establish themselves and have a good foundation for the growth of the family.  She's in charge of managing the shop store, where they sell a variety of repair supplies such as oil and parts.  Her husband offers the corresponding technical service.

She needs to have some working capital to re-stock her business and have a greater variety of products.

Among her long-term priorities is to build her house of solid materials to improve her family's quality of life and also to have a better environment for her business.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She's very happy to be part of a strong group in which she hopes to put the best of herself for the growth of her community.  This is why she's requesting 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy parts and oil for a variety of vehicles so she has more supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase parts and motor oil for cars

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi Town in Bo. She is married and has six children between the ages of 10 and 30. One of her children attends school. Mamie runs a local food business; she sells palm oil, chicken, garden eggs and gari (processed cassava flour). She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day, 6 days per week, and she has her children help her run the business. Her business is her only source of income. Mamie says that the main challenges to her business are slow purchasing power of her customers and occasional vehicle breakdowns on her way to the business. Mamie has applied for a loan in order to buy more palm oil, chickens, garden eggs and gari for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and help pay her grandchildren’s fees. In the future, next year, she plans to have a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, chickens, garden eggs and gari (processed cassava flour) for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 1, 2, 3 & 4. This group is comprised of 20 micro-entrepreuners (women and men) located on the lush, rugged Samana peninsula. Paula makes her home here in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 16th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. This businesswoman runs different sales in her business, one is selling used sewing machines (for domestic use) and the other is selling coconut oil. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing sewing machines to sell and coconuts from which to extract oil.

Paula said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy used sewing machines and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 39 años es madre soltera de 4 hijos. Actualmente reside en su casa propia que se ubica en un barrio agrícola.Vilma es una mujer ejemplar. El trabajo duro es su principal fuente de ingresos. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, ella siembra arveja, habas, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente.Su rutina se da inicio en las madrugadas ya que sus cultivos se ubican a media hora de su hogar.  Además posee animales como vacas y toros, los que pasta mientras atiende sus cultivos.“Me gusta lo que hago, con la leche de las vacas preparo quesos y se los vendo a mis vecinos ”, menciona. Por ahora se enfocará en el trabajo de campo razon por la cual sembrará arvejas y maíz, para  ello requiere de su ayuda ya que Con los 500 soles, Vilma podrá adquirir abono organico para sus próximos cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste sería su crédito número 3 con MFP. Espera el apoyo de todos de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 39, is a single mother with four children.  Currently she lives in her own house located in a farming neighborhood.  Vilma's an exemplary woman.  Hard work is her main source of income.

She has made a living in agriculture for more than 20 years.  She grows peas, beans, corn, and potatoes, which she takes care of constantly.  Her routine starts early in the morning because her crops are located half an hour from her home.  She also has animals such as cows and bulls, which she grazes while she tends to her crops.

"I like what I do.  With the milk from the cows I make cheese and sell it to my neighbors," she says.  For now she'll focus on the field work because she'll harvest peas and corn, for which she needs your help.

With the 500 soles [PEN] Vilma will be able to get organic fertilizer for her next crops.

She belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay communal bank and this would be her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for everyone's support to continue with her goals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mabal

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Mabal from Kandeh Town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 18. She sells palm oil at a big market. She began her business because she wanted to earn more income to help her husband take good care of their children. She currently also receives money from her sister. Her business is going smoothly, and she can see her income increase day-by-day. She would like a loan of SLL 900,000. Mabal needs the loan in order to buy more products for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into one of the big shops in the market and continue to improve her family's living conditions. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Faith from Kandeh Town. She is married and has two children, 6 and 19. Both of her children attend school. She was a housewife, but she started her business to help her husband take care of the family. Faith runs a business selling palm oil and gari (processed cassava flour) at a big market. She applied for the loan from BRAC Sierra Leone to start traveling to Ghana to buy clothes to sell. She would like to use the extra income from her business to educate her children and help her business grow. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Margaret from Moriba Town in the southern part of Bo. She is married and has two children, and she has four additional dependents at home. Margaret runs a palm oil business; she sells gallon containers of palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years ago. She works at the business seven days a week, 10 hours per day. She says that her business is going well. Margaret has applied for a loan in order to buy more gallon containers of palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a palm oil store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallon containers of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal door.

loans.name: Concepción Raquel

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 26 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda de productos básicos, desde hace tres años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arroz, fríjol, maíz, ázucar, jabón, etc,para instalar nuevamente la tienda, debido a que  a su hija le dio una enfermedad y se vio obligada a cerrarla y hoy en día la quiere apertura. Pues, desea ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, mejorando las condiciones de vida de toda su familia. Además, su sueño es reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepción is 26 years old and has two children.  She has owned a general store for three years.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to reopen her store and to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, soap etc.  Her daughter gave her an illness and she had to close the store, but now she is ready to open it again.  She wants to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve her family's quality of life.  Her dream is to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, soap etc in order to reopen her store.

loans.name: Celina Gisvel

texts.es:
Celina es una joven muy entusiasta y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la vivienda donde habita Celina se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor y se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, espárragos, entre otros.  Celina aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y ella empezó a apoyarlos para poder salir adelante, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Celina trabaja como empleada domestica, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres, Celina cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y honrada.

Celina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina  a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de kerosene y hace algunos días tuvo un pequeño accidente que gracias a Dios no paso a mayores, es por ello que con este gran apoyo podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Celina is a very enthusiastic young adult with a lot of motivation to get ahead.  The house Celina lives in is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a very warm and friendly climate.  A lot of agricultural work is done here, and cotton, grapes and asparagus are commonly grown, among other things.  Celina learned to work when she was very young since her parents had few economic resources.  She began to help them to be able to get ahead, and due to this she was only able to study until 5th grade, but would have liked to have been able to go to university.

Day by day Celina works as a housekeeper.  She works around 9 hours a day and with the fruit of her labor she is able to help her parents.  Celina believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and honest.

Celina is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered she will be able to buy a gas stove, since currently her stove runs on kerosene and a few days ago she had a small accident. Thanks to God it wasn't a big accident, but it is because of this that with this great support she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family and continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream reality: "To have her own home and be able to study in the university."

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Meet 45-year-old Salamatu from Torkpoi Town, Bo, in Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 15 and 25. Two are currently attending school. In 2003, Salamatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says her business is doing fine. Salamatu needs a loan in order to buy more food provisions, such as oranges. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions, such as oranges, for her retail business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una joven de 29 años de edad quien actualmente vive en Sololá junto a sus padres. Ella tiene 5 hermanas de ellas 4 estas casadas y viven independientemente y una hermana menor quien ayuda en los oficios del  hogar.
Ella se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en una tienda que tiene a unos kilómetros de su vivienda, empezó con esta actividad viendo la necesidad de generar ingresos para la familia  ya que por la falta de empleos en la comunidad decide hacer la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes que adquirió hace un año, ella aprendió a realizar este negocio hace tres años cuando trabajaba con unos vecinos fuera de su comunidad y fue donde ella tuvo la experiencia en realizar esta actividad.
Ella ve que la demanda de sus clientes y su ganancias son buenas  de esta manera quiere ampliar esta tienda solicitando un préstamo  de Q 10,000.00 para comprar más variedad de abarrotes ampliando la tienda  para brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos para la familia. 
Su mayor sueño es que en un futuro pueda construir una vivienda mejorada y seguir apoyando el desarrollo de la familia.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Sololá with her parents.  She has five sisters; four of whom are married and live independently, and one younger sister who helps with the household tasks.  María makes a living selling groceries in a store that she has a few kilometers from her home.  She started this business after seeing the need to generate income for her family.  Since there was a lack of jobs in the community she decided to start a grocery store which she acquired a year ago.   She learned how to run this business three years ago when she worked with some neighbors outside of her community where she gained experience in this activity.

María sees that her customer's demand and her income are good, so she wants to expand her store.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 GTQ to buy a larger assortment of groceries, thus increasing her store in order to offer better service and get a better income for her family.  Her great dream is that in the future she can build a better home and continue supporting the growth of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries in order to expand her store.

loans.name: Teresa Del Milagro

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido así como también su agricultura y generosidad y alegría de su gente. Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre soltera y saca adelante a sus 3 hijos de 14,10 y 4 años de edad, para Teresa sus hijos son el regalo mas grande que Dios le ha podido dar y sobre todo que son su motor para poder seguir luchando cada día a pesar de las adversidades que se le presentan; Teresa solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar medicina.

Día a día Teresa trabaja como empleada por las mañanas, ya que en las tardes ella vende productos como tamales, huevos sancochados, choclo con queso, entre  otros, ella recorre las calles de su barrio en una especie de tricilo, con lo cual tiene un ingreso mas para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de progresar.

Teresa está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá construir un espacio para su negocio y mejorar la atención a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old and lives in the city of Guadalupe which is well known for its warm climate, agriculture and the generosity and happy nature of its people. Teresa is a very hard working woman, above all because she is a single mother and is getting her three children, aged 4, 10 and 14, ahead. For Teresa, her children are the best gift that God has been able to give her and are her reason for continuing to fight everyday despite the adversity that she faces. Teresa was only able to study up to the fifth grade of secondary school because her parents had minimum economic resources. She would have liked to have studied medicine. 

Day to day, Teresa works as an employee in the mornings and in the afternoons she sells her goods including tamales, parboiled eggs, corn and cheese, and other items. She passes through the streets of her neighborhood on a tricycle, so that she can have an extra source of income to move her family forward. She belives that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and has a strong desire to improve. 

Teresa is very thankful for the support that Kiva lenders are bringing to her because thanks to this help she will be able to buy construction materials including cement, sand, bricks and other items. With these materials she will be able to build a business space and improve her customer service, allowing her to continue fighting to make her most sought after dream come true--to give her children the chance to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Progresando En Valores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group, Progresando en Valores 1, 2 & 3 (Progress in Values). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and four children. 

Ysabel is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She has had her business, which she started with some savings, for around six years. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory, by buying men's and women's clothes. She will use the profits to continue building her house. 

Ysabel says that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her house. In the meantime, she continues to enjoy sewing. Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward and, with the help of God, she will. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Muhabatjon

texts.ru:
Мухабатджон 58 лет. Она проживает со своей семьей в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. В данный момент ее старший сын и невестка находятся на заработках в России. 
У Мухабатджон среднее техническое образование, но по специальности она никогда не работала. Вот уже 38 лет как Мухабатджон занимается животноводством и является опытным скотоводом. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа крупно-рогатого скота с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Muhabatjon is 58 years old and she lives with her family in the B. Gafurovski region of Khujand.  Her elder son and his wife are currently working in Russia.  Muhabatjon has a secondary technical education, but has never worked in the field she studied.  For 38 years now, she has been involved in raising cattle and she is very experienced in this sphere.  She is asking for a loan to buy cows with the goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cows so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijas. Actualmente, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijas en una casa alquilada.  Las hijas son mayores de edad, y uno de ellas esta desempleada. Esteban es albañil, desde hace unos 20 años, posee una gran experiencia en ese rubro, también se dedica a la crianza de  pollos de engorde para luego venderlos, en esta actividad lleva un año desempeñándola. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 720 pollos de engorde y 50 gallinas ponedoras. Con la inversión, podrá emplear a su hija que no tiene trabajo para que administre la granja y obtendrá ingresos necesarios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder comprar su casa, brindar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esteban is 46. He is married and has three children. He currently lives with his wife and three daughters in a rented house. His daughters are all adults, one of whom is currently unemployed. Esteban has been a construction worker for more than 20 years. He has a broad experience in that sector. He also raises broiler chickens. He has been doing this for one year.  

Esteban is asking for a loan at Fundación Campo to purchase 720 broilers and 50 laying hens. With this investment he will be able to employ his daughter that is currently unemployed. She would manage the farm and thus generate enough income to improve the quality of life of her family, purchase their own home and provide her children with education.

loans.use: para comprar 720 pollos de engorde y 50 gallinas ponedoras.

loans.name: Selvín

texts.es:
Selvin tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo.  El trabaja como albañil, agricultor, soldador, entre otros oficios, los desempeña desde los 18 años de edad, pues su padre fue quien le enseño. También, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esto lo aprendió trabajando en una hacienda; pero el trabajo que mas disfruta y desempeña es el de las estructuras metálicas.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un taladro, compresor, esmeril; ya que los que tiene no están en muy buen estado y para preparar la tierra para sembrar y pagar mano de obra.  Él desea invertir en este negocio, ya que es el que mayores ingresos le genera. Él quiere comprar un vehiculo para uso propio.
texts.en:
Selvin is 33 years old. He's married and has a son. He works as a bricklayer, a farmer and a welder, among other trades. He has been in these lines of work ever since he was 18 years old and he learned them from his father. He also raises cattle, which he learned by working in a farm. However, the kind of work that he does and enjoys the most is the one involving metal structures.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase a drill, a compressor and an emery, since the ones that he has now aren't in very good condition. He'll also prepare the land for sowing and pay for labor. He wishes to invest in this business, because it's the one that generates the biggest profits for him. He wishes to purchase a vehicle for his personal use.

loans.use: to purchase a drill, a compressor and an emery, to prepare the land for sowing and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Donitila

texts.es: Donitila, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella lleva 6 años de tener su propio taller de zapatería donde confecciona zapatos para damas caballeros y niños de diferentes tipos de calzado. Además hace reparaciones de calzado y sandalias. Ella vende en su casa por pedidos y también sale a vender a las ferias a nivel local y nacional. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar materia prima, como ser suela, cuero, hilos, pegamento y otros que necesita para la confección de calzado que le han pedido. Con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir con ODEF y Kiva, a quienes le agradece por el apoyo que le están brindando. Su plan es lograr tener una franquicia junto con su hermano en otro sector, para ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Donitila, age 53, is married and has two children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  She has had her own shoe shop for six years.  She makes different types of shoes for men, women, and children.  She also repairs shoes and sandals.  She sells by order from her house.  She also goes to sell at the local and national fairs.

She has decided to request a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy raw material.  She will buy things like soles, leather, thread, glue, and other things she needs to make the shoes that have been ordered.

With this investment she hopes to improve her income and fulfill her commitment with ODEF and Kiva.  She is grateful for the support they have given her.  

Her plan is to manage to have a franchise with her brother in another area and to continue growing little by little.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like soles, leather, thread, and glue to make shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dilnaz

texts.ru: Дилназе 28 лет, замужем,  у них с мужем двое детей,Обы сына школьного возраста . Дилназ в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Дилназ в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 бычка, перепродажа скота на местном рынке приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. Также, Дилназ возделывает 0,66 га земли с фасолью и эспарцетом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дилназ обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков для отправки на летнее пастбище. Доходы от кредита Дилназ будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, в будущем планирует дать образование своим детям.
texts.en: Dilnaz is 28 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged sons. As the main breadwinner of the family, for the last 5 years Dilnaz has been working in the field of animal husbandry, having started this business with a sum of only 3,000 Kyrgyzstan Som. Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now includes 3 bulls, and her income from re-selling cattle on the market is around 12,000 Som per month. In addition, she cultivates a plot of land of 0.66 hectares where she grows beans and the legume sainfoin. For the purpose of further developing her business, Dilnaz has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 Som to buy 2 bulls so she can pasture them over the summer. he will use the income generated by this loan to re-invest in her business, and in the future she plans to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 27 años, es soltera y madre de 2 pequeños niños , a su vez cuenta con una casa propia en donde ha colocdado una vitrina de exhibición que le permite mostrar su mercaderia ya que el trabajo de Karina consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería como talcos, desodorantes, perfumes, colonias entre otros. Sus clientes se encuentran distribuidos por diversas calles de la ciudad, siendo estos en su mayoria familiares , vecinos y amigos . Karina trabaja bajo el sistema de venta crediticia y cumple esta función desde hace 4 años.Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en constante actividad durante el día y asi generar sus propios ingresos, ella  espera seguir trabajando de esta manera  para que en un futuro pueda  establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 para la compra de cosméticos tales como sombras , cremas corporales , talcos entre otros y a su vez se compromete a ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Karina, 27, is single and the mother of two small children.  She also has her own house where she has set up a display case to show her merchandise.  Karina's job is selling cosmetics and perfume products such as talcum powder, deodorant, perfume, cologne, and other things.

Her customers are located on different streets throughout the city and are mainly family members, neighbors, and friends.  Karina has worked under a system of credit for four years.  

She likes her job because it allows her to be constantly active during the day and generate her own income.  She hopes to continue working this way so she can set up a grocery store in her house in the future.

This time she'll request 600 soles [PEN] to buy cosmetics such as eye shadow, body lotion, talcum powder, and others.  She promises to make her loan payments very punctually.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is one of the members with a housing loan from the city of Samana. This is her 13th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her food-selling business for over eight years, starting with her own capital. With her last loan, she invested in her business, where she sells fried food. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time running their business and attending their group meetings.

Vicenta is the mother of five children and they live together with her and her long-term partner. She works and lives in a rural town in Samana. She will use this loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and other construction materials to change the wood walls in her house to concrete blocks. She thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks and cement

loans.name: San Ramon Solidarity Group

texts.es: El Grupo San Ramón conformado por dos miembros los cuales son Delmi Raquel Y Martha Lorena ambas solteras ellas pertenecen al departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país la cual es una zona muy comercial y existe gran demanda. Delmi tiene dos hijos 3 y 7 años ambos estudian, ella inicia su negocio con la ayuda de su mama quien siempre la ha apoyado y como salió la oportunidad de vender en una cuadrilla del ingenio decide aventurarse sola y gracias a dios le ha ido bien hasta la fecha, Martha tiene cinco hijos de 24,29,30,31 y 34 años de edad todos trabajan, ella inicia su negocio buscando un medio de subsistencia debido a que sus hijos estaban estudiando ella era madre y padre a la misma vez para ellos primeramente comienza con la venta de refrescos y enchiladas en los buses, pero después comenzó a llevar comida y de esa manera fue haciendo clientela hoy en día su negocio es su mayor fuente de empleo ambas tienen más de 10 años de tener este negocio. Ellas  están solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, platos desechables, refrescos, azúcar, café, entre otros. El Grupo San Ramón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The San Ramón group consists of two members, Delmi Raquel and Martha Lorena. Both are single. They are from the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country, which is a very commercial area with a lot of activity. Delmi has two children, ages 3 and 7, both of whom are in school. She began her business with the help of her mother, who has always supported her, and as the opportunity arose to sell to sugar mill workers, she decided to set out on her own, and, thanks to God, it has gone well for her so far. Martha has five children, ages 24, 29, 30, 31, and 34, all of whom are working. She began her business looking for a means of subsistence because her children were in school. She was both mother and father at the same time for them. First she began with the sale of soft drinks and enchiladas on buses, but later she began to prepare meals, and in this way she began to acquire customers. Now her business is her main source of employment. Each has had her business for more than 10 years. They are applying for the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, disposable plates, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, and other items. The San Ramón group is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, disposable plates, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, and other products

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a member of the group called Nuevo Progreso 4 (New Progress 4), located in the city of Samana. This is his seventh loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over six years, started from his savings.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Jose realised the need to build his home's roof.  With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can pay for it and save for more home improvements. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to start with the house construction. Now he will build this house roof and make other change like floors, etc.

Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. 

Jose lives together with his long term partner, who is also the mother of his 3 children. He is also a micro-entrepreneur conducting fish sales. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for his wholesale bakery company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment to expand their business

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbat, a 33-year-old man, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in his brother’s house on plot of land. He has been rendering a tire repair service since 2005. With just 2000000 MNT, he began his tire repair service and over the years he has accumulated vast amount of experience. His seven-year-old son goes to elementary school and now is in second grade. His wife is unemployed and now stays at home to care for their younger child. He has got loan from our organization five times and paid each loan on established schedules without delay. He is requesting a loan of 500000 MNT to purchase spare parts and tools in large quantity. As a result, he can run his tire repair business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La señora  Mirian tiene 23 años, tiene  2 hijos,  es madre soltera, reside junto a sus hijos  en una comunidad del   Municipio de Tela, departamento de Atlántida.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, además vende cosméticos.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 13 ,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de ropa de temporada de verano, cremas, lociones, bloqueadores solares y acondicionadores.
Mirian espera aprovechar la temporada de verano para incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarles educación escolar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian is 23 years old and a single mother with two children. She and her children reside in a community in the town of Tela in the Department of Atlántida.

For the past three years, Mirian has been selling clothes for women, men, and children. She also sells cosmetics. At the moment, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 HNL which she plans to invest in the purchase of summer clothing, crèmes, lotions, sunscreen, and conditioners.

Mirian hopes to take advantage of the summer season to increase her sales and her earnings. This will enable her to improve her quality of life and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing, crèmes, lotions, sunscreen, and conditioners.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохире 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Мохира обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она нуждается в источнике дохода, так как доход ее отца от выращивания сельхоз культур маленький. Недавно в семье они проводили мероприятие и затратили все сбережения. Данное время у них очень тяжелое условие проживания и поэтому она очень нуждается поддержки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 850 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы организовать свой бизнес. Она имеет опыт выращиванию скота и считает, что это не убыточный бизнес, так как скот имеет большой спрос на местном рынке. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohira is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She took a course entitled "Get Ahead" organised by the Association of Businesswomen and for which she received a certificate. Now she wants to set up her own business. She needs a source of income because the earnings of her father, who grows crops for a living, are very small. The family recently hosted a celebration and their savings were depleted. They are currently facing very difficult living conditions, which is why Mohira really needs support. She is seeking a loan of 850 US dollars to buy cattle so she can start her own business. She has experience raising cattle and considers this field to be a profitable one to get into, since there is a great demand for cattle on the local market. Mohira is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Соджида является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж занимается земледелием  и его доход не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Соджида решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей   скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США  для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult life circumstances force people to channel their efforts and galvanize their existing resources. Sojida is one such person who is trying to improve her standard of living and jumpstart the economic situation of her family. She is married and has 4 children at home. Her husband works in farming but his income is not sufficient to provide his family with all their necessities. Sojida has decided to help her husband for the welfare of the family. For this reason, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" organised by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She wants to set up her own business buying and re-selling cattle because she has experience in this area. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to give her children a good education and nutritious food. Sojida is seeking a loan of 1,300 US dollars to buy cattle to establish her new business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy legal stationery and notary certificates and to pay for filing fees.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es: Calixto, tiene 43 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Don Calixto tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, el cultiva café y lo vende en pergamino y por latas en el mercado local.  El ha mantenido su finca en buen estado mediante la inversión de varios prestamos con ODEF, el préstamo que solicita actualmente es el numero 15 y es por 3,000 Lempiras, el cual  lo  invertirá  en la compra de abono y pago de limpieza a la finca de café. Todos los préstamos le han ayudado a mantener buenas cosechas, al igual que esta inversión le ayudara a  incrementar mas la producción en la próxima cosecha. Su plan es terminar de educar a sus últimos dos hijos que tiene en casa.
texts.en:
Calixto is 43 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Don Calixto has been a farmer for 10 years. He grows coffee and sells it in cans with its parchment at the local market. Calixto has been able to keep his farm in good condition by investing several loans from ODEF. The loan he is currently requesting is his 15th transaction and amounts to 3,000 HNL. He will invest it in the purchase of compost and will also pay for labor to have his coffee farm cleared. All of his loans have helped him to maintain a good crop as well as increase his production for the next season. His plan is to see his two children, who are living at home, finish their education.

loans.use: to buy compost and pay for labor to clear his coffee farm.

loans.name: Mutabarhon

texts.ru:
Мутабархон жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 28 лет. Она живет с мужем. У них один ребёнок. Она добрая, отзывчивая женщина. У Мутабархон среднее образование. 
Вместе с мужем Мутабархон занимается животноводством. Она берет кредит для закупа коров и телят, чтобы увеличить поголовья крупнорогатого скота и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mutabarhon lives in the town of Istaravshan. She is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband. They have one  child. She is a kind and thoughtful woman. Mutabarhon has received secondary education. Together with her husband, she raises livestock. She is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle head count and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle head count and expand her business.

loans.name: Amada Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Amada vive en Libertad, tiene 35 años de edad. Tiene un negocio en donde vende productos AVON, el trabajo lo realiza con su hija todo el día. En este negocio lo que mas vende son maquillaje, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Es una persona enferma, pero su hija conoce a los clientes a quienes les vende los productos así que cuando la clienta se enferma la hija le ayuda a poder cobrar el dinero a los clientes.

Está casada, tiene una hija que estudia en un colegio fiscal y su esposo que es pescador quien le ayuda en los gastos de la casa, para así juntos salir adelante.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar maquillaje, cremas, perfumes.  El sueño que tiene con este préstamo es que su negocio se mantenga porque le gusta vender todo lo que está relacionado con maquillaje y bisutería.
texts.en:
Amada, 35, lives in Libertad.  She has a business where she sells AVON products.  She works with her daughter every day.  What she sells the most in her business is make-up, creams, perfume, etc.  

She’s not in good health but her daughter knows the customers she sells her products to so whenever she’s not well her daughter helps her collect payments from her customers.  She’s married and has a daughter attending public school; her husband’s a fisherman who helps her with the household expenses so they can get ahead together.  

She intends to use the loan to buy make-up, creams and perfume.  The dream she has with this loan is to stay in business because she likes selling everything related to make-up and costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy make-up, creams and perfume.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr: Marie Claire est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 28 ans qui mène comme activité la vente de boisson dans un quartier de la ville depuis 02 ans. le stock de boisson dont elle dispose en permanence ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. elle voudrait ainsi avec ce crédit acheter de la boisson pour renforcer son stock, ce qui va augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent son bénéfice. ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Claire is a young woman from Cameroon.  She is 28 years old and, for the past two years, she has been selling drinks in one of her town's neighborhoods.  However, her stock of drinks does not allow her to adequately meet her customers' needs.  This is why she intends to use her loan to buy some drinks in order to boost her stock and increase her sales and profits.  This will allow Marie Claire to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants. Elle exerce un commerce de produits alimentaires au marché de sa localité. Ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 150 000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Bineta is a married woman. She is the mother of three children. She sells food products at the local market. This business allows her to provide for herself and her children. In order to bolster her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 150,000 West African franks to buy food products.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Al Hamdillilahi Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALIFOU représente le groupe AL HAMDILLILAHI. Il  se porte bien. Marié ? est maintenant père de 02 enfants. Ils sont jumeaux et ont 06mois. Personne ne va à l’école et il a 03 personnes en charge.
Il vend de produits divers (boutique) depuis 07ans. Il s’approvisionne  au secteur 22. Ses clients  sont les  habitants du secteur.
Mr veut s’acheter 05 sacs de riz, 03sacs. de sucre et 03 bidons d’huile
Il désire renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Il ambitionne maintenant devenir grossiste et mieux inscrire ses enfants à l’école dans des bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
SALIFOU is the leader of the AL HAMDILLILAHI group.  He is doing well.  He is married and is now the father of six-month-old twins.  He has no dependent in school but takes care of three people.

He has been selling various grocery products for the past seven years.  He stocks up in District 22, and sells to local residents.  He wants to buy five bags of rice, three bags of sugar and three cans of oil.

He would like to use his profits to strengthen his activity.  His ambition is to become a wholesaler and to send his children to school, under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy five bags of rice, three bags of sugar and three cans of oil.

loans.name: Jesenia Esmit

texts.es:
Jesenia es una joven madre de 29 años de edad, su pequeña tiene 1 añito de edad y por ella Jesenia daría la vida con tal de verla feliz y sobre todo que tenga mejores oportunidades que las que Jesenia tuvo, por ello le brinda todo su amor y su lucha diaria. La vivienda donde habita Jesenia se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual es una ciudad que se encuentra ubicada en la selva peruana, en la cual podemos apreciar paisajes hermosos y fauna variada. Jesenia trabaja desde muy joven y gracias a su esfuerzo logro estudiar carrera de turismo, pero debido a que no encontraba empleo logro con mucho esfuerzo iniciar su negocio de servicio de costura y confección de prendas y con ello puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y realiza su trabajo con mucho cuidado y dedicación.

Jesenia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando podrá comprar una maquina remalladora y telas al por mayor para poder atender los pedidos de uniformes escolares de sus clientes, de esta manera podrá tener los materiales necesarios y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en:
Jesenia is a young mother of 29 years of age. Her little one is 1 year old and it is for her that Jesenia would give her life to see her happy, and above all to see her have better opportunities than those that Jesenia had. It is for her that Jesenia dedicates all her love and her daily struggle.

Jesenia's home is located in the city of Pucallpa, which is a city in the Peruvian jungle, where one can appreciate beautiful landscapes and diverse fauna.

Jesenia has been working since she was very young, and thanks to her hard work she was able to study tourism. However, because she could not find employment she was able with much effort to start her own business dedicated to the sewing and manufacture of garments. Through this work she is able, with much care, to cover the costs of her home. Jesenia believes that she is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and completes her work with a lot of care and dedication. 

Jesenia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since the support they are offering her will enable her to buy a darning machine and wholesale fabrics in order to attend to her customer's orders for school uniforms. In this way, she will be able to have all the necessary materials and improve her income. This will allow her to continue striving to realize her greatest dream: "to give her daughter a good education."

loans.use: to buy a darning machine and wholesale fabrics

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам проживает в районе Спитамен. Ему 38 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Жена Уктама работает учительницей в средней школе. Сам Уктам занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занимается этим видом деятельности более 10 лет. В этом бизнесе ему помогает семья. Еще он имеет доход от продажи молока от дойных коров. Дополнительно семья Уктама занимается выращиванием селхозкультур на арендуемых землях. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес Уктам обратился за кредитом для закупа скота и в дальнейшем его откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Uktam lives in the Spitamen Region. He is 38 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a secondary school teacher. Uktam buys and resells cattle. He has been in this business for over 10 years. His family helps him out in the business. He earns an additional income by selling milk of his dairy cows. In addition, Uktam’s family grows produce on leased land plots. In order to expand his business, Uktam has applied for a loan to buy cattle for fattening and later resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with 5 children. Merlyn is 44 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Merlyn is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her garden. 

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Mary Alice

texts.en:
Mary Alice is 41 years old and married with two children who are in school. Mary Alice works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Alice runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, frozen products, spices, soap, etc.

Mary Alice has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mary Alice would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, frozen products, spices, soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is married with 3 children. Rosalita is 54 years old and lives in Maribijoc, Tudela, Mis.Occ., Philippines.

Rosalita is a farmer and produces corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production. 

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Rosalita hopes to supplement her family income.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Empenita

texts.en:
Empenita is married with 4 children. Empenita is 60 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Empenita is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. Empenita has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

Empenita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Empenita hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 47 years-old, married and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elisa has a business making foam beds in the Philippines. Elisa requested a loan of 40,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy raw materials to make foam beds.

Elisa has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. Nellie is married with 4 children. 

Nellie has a sari-sari (general) store business and earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month doing this type of work. Nellie has requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, etc.

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Nellie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 39 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Миргул на протяжении 18 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с мужем сразу после свадьбы. Благодаря упорному труду Миргул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство, продажа молока и молочных продуктов составляет 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для последующей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mirgul is 39 years old, married, with four children. Mirgul has been raising livestock for 18 years, having launched this business soon after getting married. Thanks to Mirgul’s hard work, her farm today is really well developed; sales of milk and dairy products amount to about 15,000 KGS per month. In order to continue growing her business, Mirgul has applied to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS  to buy bulls for later resale. Mirgul plans to use the resulting revenues to increase her livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bulls for future resale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old, married, and has four children. With two children in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, and other goods.

Fe has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.
