loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lydia is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en su ciclo número diez, y hay que destacar que todas ellas han trabajado mucho por salir adelante y tener de esa forma un mejor ingreso para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Catalina ella tiene 6 hijos,  está casada con el Sr. Roberto, ella se dedica hace varios años al corte y confección de todo tipo de trabajos, como ser prendas, sabanas, cortinados y demás. Cuenta la Sra. Catalina  que por medio de este trabajo ha dado a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin necesidades, y es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación is in its tenth cycle, and it's important to emphasize that all of them have worked a lot to get ahead to have a better income to be able to help their families.

One of the group members is Catalina.  She has six children and is married to Roberto.  She has made a living for several years cutting and making all kinds of jobs, such as garments, sheets, curtains, and other things.  Catalina says that with this job she has given her family everything they need for a life without needs.

This is why she's requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying fabric, thread, buttons, and other things, so she can continue working and doing her job.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Con gran esfuerzo el Grupo La Perla del Sur, está en su ciclo doce, donde cada una de ellas está dando todo de sí para poder mejorar sus vidas y también la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Susana, ella tiene un comedor en el local de una empresa muy conocida de venta de autos, trabaja ahí deleitando a sus clientes con la variedad de comidas que hace. Le está yendo muy bien, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y aceptadas por sus clientes. Gracias al trabajo que hace esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Cuenta la Sra. Susana que solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende y así seguir teniendo los medios para seguir luchando.
texts.en: With a lot of hard work the La Perla del Sur group is in its 12th loan cycle. Every one of the members is giving her all to be able to improve the lives of themselves and their families. One of the members is Susana, who has an eatery at a well-known local business that sells cars. She works there delighting her customers with the various foods she makes. The business is going very well, since her food is very tasty and draws rave review from her customers. Thanks to this work she is making headway and helping her family. Susana is requesting the loan to purchase meats, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients so she can keep making the foods she sells and continue having the means to keep fighting.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr:
Magatte est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux enfants dont l'un est élève à l'école primaire. Elle fait un commerce de produits céréaliers en achetant notamment du mil en gros pour le revendre au détail.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ainsi qu'à ses propres besoins.
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des sacs de mil.
texts.en: Magatte is married and the mother of two children, one of whom goes to primary school.  She sells grains, specifically millet, which she buys in bulk quantities before selling it for retail.  Thanks to this business, she makes quite a good income and is able to meet her needs as well as those of her family.  In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs in order to buy some bags of millet.

loans.use: to buy bags of millet.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Marilou has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries such as snack foods, canned goods, dried fish and school supplies.

She has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like snack foods, canned goods, dried fish and school supplies.

loans.name: Cuenta Conmigo Group

texts.es:
El comité “Cuento Contigo” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo, y de esa forma se ayudan a salir adelante.
Cristina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, es parte de este grupo, y con su trabajo trata de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que siempre se esfuerza mucho. Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de segunda mano, ya que le está yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
The group  “Cuento Contigo” [ I Depend on You] was formed by various women neighbors in the city of Santaní. 

The members formed a very tight group who together do activities that strengthen their partnership and help each other to get ahead. 

Cristina, who sells second hand clothing, is part of this group. With her work she tries to get ahead and help her family. 

She is a person who wants to get ahead and always tries hard.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in buying second hand clothing since this is going very well for her.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su 7º.ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades y están saliendo adelante gracias al trabajo que todas hacen, ya que son madres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Alejandra es una de las miembros, ella es una persona por sobre todo muy valiente y con ganas de progresar, su trabajo consiste en la recolección y compra – venta de artículos reciclados. Compra y los revende para poder tener mayor ganancia. Gracias a este trabajo esta saliendo adelante y da a su familia lo que necesitan. Esta orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de plásticos, botellas, bolsas, cartón, etc. Los cuales va a revender y tener un mejor margen de ganancia y así dar a su familia lo que puede dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en: This group is in its seventh loan cycle, and we can say that this group is very responsible. All of the members have businesses and are making headway thanks to all the effort they have put in as working mothers. Alejandra is a member of the group. She is above all very brave and eager to make progress. She makes a living collecting and buying/selling recyclables. She buys the items and then can sell them for a profit. Thanks to this work she is making headway and giving her family what it needs. She is proud of the work she does, since it is decent and, above all, honest work. She is requesting the loan to purchase plastics, bottles, bags, cardboard and other items to resell so she has a better profit margin and give her family what she can within her means.

loans.use: to purchase plastics, bottles, bags, cardboard and other items to resell.

loans.name: Marangatu Rape Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Marangatu Rape está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 personas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, siendo su ingreso mucho menor, casi en la pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ella está trabajando arduamente en la venta de prendas, ya que quiere poder mejorar su nivel de ingresos para poder darle una mayor ayuda a su familia y poder mejorar sus vidas. Gracias al apoyo que está recibiendo se ve muy esperanzada a seguir luchando por todo lo que sueña.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas y procurar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The Marangatu Rape group is in its fifth loan cycle. In a poverty-elimination survey, six of the members were below the poverty line, with an income much lower, almost in extreme poverty. One of the members is Lidia, who in her last survey was found to be below the poverty line. She is working arduously selling clothes, since she wants to be able to increase her income so she can better help her family and improve their lives. Thanks to the support she is receiving she is very hopeful about continuing to fight for her dreams. She is requesting the loan to purchase all kinds of clothes so she can continue with her sales and earn better income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Bernadeth has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income by raising livestock.

Bernadeth has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. She is 25 years old and single. Riza has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Riza requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Elizabeth Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is married with seven children.

Elizabeth is one of the most hardworking women in her area. She operates a small business in which she sells banana cue. She requested a loan to buy materials - bananas, sticks, and other items - for her small business.

She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Elizabeth is the leader of a two person group. Although they are borrowing as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to make and sell banana cue.

location.town: Ozamis-P9 Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 67 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dominga has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business like paint, bamboo, fishing net, etc.

Dominga has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Dominga would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business like paint, bamboo, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is single with two children. Teresita is 59 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Teresita sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Teresita has requested a loan to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Jose

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad cálida y acogedora con una agricultura variada y poseedora de atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Huacachina. Cada día Daniel se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres, es por ello que Daniel trabaja como vigilante, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y luego de culminada su labor diaria el va a su centro de estudios ya que se encuentra estudiando la carrera de computación e informática, el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Daniel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando podrá comprar una computadora  para poder realizar sus prácticas estudiantiles, así poder tener las herramientas necesarias para poder seguir estudiando y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 21 years old young adult who lives in the city of Ica, a warm and friendly city with varied agriculture and tourist attractions such as the lagoon of Huacachina. 

Every day, Daniel tries hard to get ahead and support his parents. This is the reason why Daniel works as a guard. He works about eight hours a day and after his daily work he goes to a study center because he is studying a computer science degree. He believes he is getting ahead because he is very responsible and above all, eager to get ahead.

Daniel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are providing, he will be able to buy a computer for his internship. With that, he will have all the necessary tools to keep studying and to strive to realize his biggest dream: "To finish his career and to have his own house".

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.fr:
Claudine fait partie du groupe Indatwa et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de  4 à 15 ans,  dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de patate douce, de manioc, de haricot, depuis 12 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter un sac supplémentaire de patates douces. Tous ses produits vivriers(patate douce, manioc, haricot, ...) seront revendus, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait faire le commerce de chèvres et  satisfaire convenablement les besoins familiaux de ses enfants (alimentation, habillement,). Elle voudrait en outre  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claudine is part of the group Indatwa and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and married to Emmanuel, a farmer. Together they have six children, from 4 to 15 years old, of whom five are students. 

She has been doing commerce in sweet potatoes, cassava, and beans for twelve years. 

She is on her second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase an additional sack of sweet potatoes. All of her staple products (sweet potatoes, cassava, beans,..) will be sold, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to do commerce in goats and to meet in a suitable manner the family needs of her children (food, clothing).  Besides this, she would like to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine est une femme mariée.Elle achète et vend des tissus et articles de mercerie qu'elle place auprès de ses clients avant de les récupérer au bout de quelques mois. Ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses trois enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce , elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des tissus.
texts.en: Yacine is a married woman. She purchases cloth and sewing supplies for hers customers and then collects payments after a few months. This business enables her to meet her own needs, as well as those of her three children. To bolster her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to purchase some cloth.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Edilma

texts.en:
Edilma is 64 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is divorced with six children.
 
To earn a living, Edilma has a business selling fish in the community. She earns about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Edilma has requested a loan to purchase additional fish to sell.

Edilma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Edilma would like to improve the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Desiree is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

Desiree has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Desiree requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase extra materials for her repair shop.

Desiree has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Desiree would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase extra materials for her repair shop.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 53 years old and is married with two children. To generate income, she has been engaged in a hog-raising business for five years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) with each piglet she sells. 

Arcelie wants to lift her children out of poverty; that's why she works hard. At this moment, she needs more capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can finish the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is single. Jocelyn is 44 years old and lives in Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Jocelyn sells cellphone load credits to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, Jocelyn earns 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. Jocelyn has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase additional load credits for her business.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Jocelyn hope to save to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphone load credits.

loans.name: Rambha Devi

texts.en:
Rambha Devi is a 35-year-old married woman from the Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District. She is a hardworking woman and has one child. 

For the past three years, she has been selling different types of fertilizer in her village. She has a good customer base. She buys fertilizer from big vendors at a low price and sells it to fellow farming villagers. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 NPR (Nepal rupees) to buy more fertilizer for her inventory so that she can meet the increasing demand of the customers at the right time. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to sell to village farmers.

loans.name: Gyanti Devi

texts.en:
Gyanti, 37 years old, lives in the Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara district with her husband and two children. Gyanti has a concrete mixer that is used to mix the sand and cement so that mixture can be used for constructing buildings. Both Gyanti and her husband are actively involved in this business. The family is making a good earning from this business. 

Gyanti has requested a loan amount of 40,000 NPR (Nepalese rupees) to buy another concrete mixing machine so that she can expand her business to meet the increasing demand in the area. She has used the money earned from the business for a quality education of her children. This business has helped her earn money and respect in the society. By expanding the business, she is hoping to catch the opportunity provided by the increasing house construction in that area.

loans.use: to pay for a concrete mixing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kiosk stuff such as a display window, mobile phone rechargers, instant noodles, sugar, coffee, tea, frying oil, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Greseldo

texts.en:
Greseldo is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Greseldo is 31 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Greseldo has a food vending business in the Philippines. Greseldo requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Greseldo has been in this business for one year. In the future, Greseldo would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ginna Paola

texts.es: Ginna tiene 22 años vive con sus padres y su hermana menor su deseo mas grande es estudian por medi de su estudio mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle a sus padres una ayuda para su futuro, ella tiene muchas metas junto con su familia y si continua estudiando todos los esfuerzos que realizaron sus familiares para darle su bachillerato no serian en vano. Ella quiere ser ejemplo de superacion para sus seres queridos y el dia de mañana puedan tener una mano amiga para confiar y seguir adelante ya que su hermana menor apenas esta en el colegio y ella quiere ser un gran ejemplo quiere que ella vea que estudiar es muy importante el futuro de toda la familia. Su sueño es mejorar cada dia y verse crecer de muchas maneras academica y laboralmente ella sabe que porn medio de su formaciòn en Campoalto va poder desarrollar diferentes competencias que le permitiran ubicarse laboralmente ella es una chica muy luchadora y esta muy dispuesta a dar todo siempre esta muy orientada tener buenos resultados, ella sabe que el camino no es facil pero tiene que ser fuerte para conseguir todo lo que quiere y llegar a las metas que tiene, quiere tener su propia casa tambien y mejorar la calidad de vida de muchas personas por medio de su profesion que inicia con la ayuda de este prestamo ella les da muchas gracias a las personas que leen su historia por tomarse el tiempo de conocer su historia y apoyarla en este prestamo de la misma forma espera gratificar el respaldo de todas las personas que lleguen apoyarla
texts.en:
Ginna is 22 years old; she lives with her parents and her younger sister. Her greatest wish is to get an education, and through her studies, to improve her quality of life and give her parents help in the future.

She has many goals, along with her family, and if she continues studying, all of the effort that her family members made in order for her to get her Bachelor’s degree will not be in vain. She wants to be an example of overcoming for her loved ones so that tomorrow, they can have a helping hand in order to trust and move ahead, since her younger sister is only in high school and she wants to be a good example. She wants her sister to see that getting an education is very important for the entire family’s future.

Her dream is to improve every day and to see herself grow in many ways, both academically and professionally. She knows that through her education in CampoAlto, she will be able to develop different skills that will allow her to find a job.

She is a girl who is a fighter, and she is always ready to give everything she has. She is very focused on getting good results; she knows that the path is not easy, but she has to be strong in order to achieve everything that she wants and reach the goals that she has set. 

She wants to have her own house, and also to improve the quality of life for many people by means of her career that she is beginning with the assistance from this loan. She is very thankful to the people who are reading her story for taking the time to know her story and support her in this loan. Likewise, she hopes to repay the backing from all of the people who support her.

loans.use: to begin her CampoAlto program in Pharmaceutical Services.

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is married with three children. Revelyn is 39 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Revelyn is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to redeem her rice field.

Revelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Revelyn hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to redeem her rice field

loans.name: Phema

texts.en:
Phema works hard to support her family. Phema is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Phema requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, paint, wood, etc for the repair of her fishing boat.

Phema has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Phema would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, paint, wood, etc to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her restaurant business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn, 27, works hard to provide for her family. She is engaged in a piggery business as a source of income. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan to buy feed and vitamins. She is hoping for a higher income this time. Genalyn aspires to save enough money for the education of her three children and hopes to attain it soon through her hard work.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 33 years old and an industrious mother. She is very enthusiastic to support her family through her fish-selling business. With this kind of occupation, she is able to provide for her family's basic necessities, but she is aiming for a higher way of living. This caused her to request a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to make her business more productive with her loan and to earn sufficient income for the improvement of her family’s living situation.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercedita is 49 years old. Four of her children are in school.

Mercedita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years. In the futre, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 50-year-old fish vendor. She sells fresh and dried fish in the community.  Despite her age, she is working hard for the sake of her two children. She is always looking for a way to make a better living. Elsie is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to utilize in her business, specifically to buy more dried fish, which will improve and enhance her daily income.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Megeline

texts.en:
Megeline is 48 years old and married with one kid in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Megeline runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Megeline would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception works hard to support her family. Conception is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Conception requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Conception has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Conception would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing business

loans.name: Weldemina

texts.en:
Weldemina is a 43-year-old woman who is married to Yermias, 47. Weldemina has been blessed with five children: Ferianto, 21, is attending university; Lady, 19, is working; Yosefina, 12, is attending first grade of junior high school; Angel, 5, is attending kindergarten; and Johanis, is 2 years old. 

Two years ago, Weldemina established a small business based at her home. She sells vegetable i.e. long beans, mustard greens, eggplant, squash, beans, etc to get extra income.  Weldemina sees that the availability of vegetable stock and other cooking spices is very limited and inadequate to meet customer’s needs. That is why she applied for a loan from TLM of 3,000,000 IDR to purchase additional cooking spices (white pepper, ginger, ginger plant, turmeric, salt, and cinnamon), and more vegetables. She is hoping that her income will increase with those things.

loans.use: to purchase cooking spices (white pepper, ginger, ginger plant, turmeric, salt, and cinnamon) and more vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 60 años esta casada desde hace 47 años con Hugo con quien tiene 7 hijos, ambos tiene una casa propia en donde viven junto a 2 de sus hijos. Rosa, tiene como trabajo la venta de comida. Prepara a diario los mas ricos desayunos y almuerzos que deleitan el paladar de sus clientes. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de la atención durante las mañanas mientras que ella se dirige al mercado para comprar todo lo necesario para la preparación de los platillos del día siguiente. A su retorno del mercado, ayuda también con la atención al público, siempre de la mano con un trato agradable que es su mejor carta de presentación. Su puesto de trabajo está ubicado cerca a su hogar , frente a un hospital razón por la  cual siempre cuenta clientes . Lleva en este rubro más de 21 años y lo complementa con la venta de golosinas y frutas. 
Este trabajo le ha generado muy  buenas ganancias económicas razón por la cual esta muy satisfecha , pero también es conciente  que su clientela exige mucho en cuanto a sabor y comodidad . Es por eso que en esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de ingredientes al por mayor tales como arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros abarrotes que usa continuamente en su trabajo , y a su vez  comprará una mesa amplia y de buena calidad para sus clientes . Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas y agradece la oportunidad brindada por MFP.
texts.en:
Rosa, 60, has been married to Hugo for 47 years and they have seven children.  They live in their own house with two of their children.  Rosa sells food for a living and prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches to the delight of her customers.  Her husband helps by attending to the stall in the morning while she goes to the market to buy all the necessary ingredients for her cooking.  When she gets back from the market she also attends to customers with kindness, which is her best letter of presentation.  Her business is located close to home and to the hospital, so she has a constant flow of customers.

Rosa has been in this business for 21 years and also sells sweets and fruit.  Since her job has generated a good profit, she is very satisfied, but also conscious of the fact that her clientele are very demanding in terms of flavor and comfort.  Therefore, she is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy wholesale ingredients such as rice, oil, sugar and other groceries that she uses constantly on the job.  She will also buy a bigger and better table for her customers.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and is grateful for this opportunity from MFP.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Mme ABIBATA est la représentante du groupe MANDE 2. ABIBATA se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgée 15ans et le moins âgée a 07ans. Tous  vont  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des légumes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  pissy .Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes. Elle est très contente. 
Mme veut  s’acheter  01 sac de gombo sec ; 02 sacs de choux et 02 sacs d’aubergines et autres légumes sec.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son hangar. Mme tient toujours ses ambitions qui sont  d’ouvrir une boutique de stockage pour les légumes et de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abibata is the leader of the MANDE 2 group.  She is doing well, and so are the other members of her group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 15, her youngest is 7.  All three attend school.  She has three people in her care.

Abibata has been selling vegetables for the past two years.  She stocks up at the Pissy market and sells to both men and women.  She is very happy.

Abibata wants to buy one bag of dry gumbo (okra), two bags of cabbage, two bags of eggplants and other dry vegetables.  She plans to use her profits to increase the size of her stall.  Her goals remain the same: she would like to open a warehouse to store her vegetables, and she wants to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy one bag of dry gumbo (okra), two bags of cabbage, two bags of eggplants and other dry vegetables.

loans.name: Titolivio

texts.es: Titolivio, tiene la edad  de 63 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras a inicios de lluvia y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Titolivio, 63, is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his top priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides and to hire workers to help with his coffee crop.  He will also buy plants for transplanting when the rains begin so he can increase his plantation, taking advantage of the fertile soil and climate conditions favorable to the coffee crop.

With these crop improvements he hopes to increase his earnings and improve his family's living conditions.  He also wants to invest more in the crop area and meet some of his goals.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan, but FUDECOSUR is giving him better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy supplies and hire workers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Juán

texts.es: Juán, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casado pero vive solo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y algunos productos orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y realizar trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras a inicios de lluvia y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y de esta manera utilizar mejor el terreno, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juán, 57, is married but he lives alone.  He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and organic products to help improve soil conditions for his coffee crop.  He also wants to buy plants for transplanting when the rains begin so he can increase his plantation.  This will enhance the use of the fertile soil and climate conditions favorable to the coffee crop.

With these crop improvements, Juán hopes to increase his earnings and improve his family's living conditions.  He also wants to invest more in the crop area and meet some of his goals.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan, but FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Stephany Cristina

texts.es:
Stephany es una joven de 19 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee atractivos turísticos como las líneas de Nazca y los acueductos de Cahuachi. Stephany disfruta de escuchar música en sus pocos tiempos libres ya que ella trabaja como empleada en una zapatería de su ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja 8 horas al día y cada día se levanta con muchos ánimos; es por ello que Stephany cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con lo clientes que atiende en su trabajo y es muy responsable.

Stephany está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá solventar los gastos de matrícula ya que ha ingresado a la carrera de Contabilidad, de esta manera ella podrá asistir a sus clases sin ningún problema y seguir luchando para poder mejorar cada día y luchar por cumplir su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera profesional y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Stephany, 19, is a young woman who lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for its warm, welcoming climate.  It also has tourist attractions such as the Nazca Lines and the Cahuachi aqueducts.  Stephany enjoys listening to music in her brief free time since she works at a shoe store in the city.  Through her work she is able to help her parents cover the household expenses.  She works eight hours a day and gets up every morning with optimism.  Stephany believes work is going well because she is very kind to the customers and responsible.

Stephany is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to them she is able to pay for her higher education, having begun work on an Accounting degree.  This means she can attend classes without any problems and continue working toward her goal of "Finishing her professional career and helping her family.".

loans.use: To pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 1 hija , ella vive en su casa propia  .El trabajo de Maritza consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, muchas veces espera a que el cliente venga y le pida un diseño o la refacción de alguna prenda, en otras ocasiones ella misma se inspira en nuevos diseños y crea sus propias prendas en el que destaca su estilo personal, además de confeccionar prendas de vestir, también se dedica a confeccionar sabanas y cortinas para venderlas entre sus clientes, familiares y amigos. Su taller está ubicado en su hogar . Lleva realizando este negocio por 11 años y con el tiempo aprendió a darle un buen acabado a su trabajo.Le gusta lo que hace ya que trabaja de manera independiente, tiene su propio horario de trabajo y además le brinda a otras personas la oportunidad de laborar ya que en ciertas temporadas contrata personal ya que no se abastecesola, recuerda mucho como se inició en esta actividad, ya que trabajaba para otra persona y buscó consolidar su propio negocio y esa decisión acertada se refleja en los ingresos que ahora percibe. Desea continuar realizando su trabajo y más adelante poder tener un taller más grande con máquinas y trabajadores a su servicio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de confección como hilos, agujas, botones, telas, forros y blondas para continuar confeccionando las prendas de vestir y sábanas que pone a la venta, además comprará algunas herramientas que le hacen falta en su taller de confección.
texts.en:
Maritza, 42, is divorced and has a daughter who lives with her in her own house.  Maritza is a seamstress and makes and alters clothing.  Many times, she receives customer orders for a design or alteration, while other times she is inspired to create new designs and come up with her personal style.  She also makes sheets and curtains for customers, relatives and friends.  She works from home and has been in business for 11 years.  Over time, she has learned to produce a well-finished garment.  She enjoys working independently and having her own work schedule.  When busy, she hires people to help her, so she also provides employment opportunities.

She remembers well how she got started.  She was working for someone else and wanted to set up her own business.  It was a good decision as her income now shows.  She wants to continue her work and set up a larger sewing shop in the future, with larger machines and hired workers.

On this occasion, she is requesting 1,000 PEN and is grateful to lenders who are giving her the opportunity to meet her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She will use it to buy sewing materials, such as thread, needles, buttons, fabric, lining material and lace to continue making clothing and sheets.  She also plans to buy tools for her sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Princesas Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Los socios de Princesas Guerreras  venden joyas de plata, cosméticos y perfumes y amasandería (pan, torta, dulces, empanadas).
 Marcela vende lencería y ropa, principalmente en colegios. Compra su mercadería  en Santiago su. Trabaja en eso hace 10 años. Va a ocupar el préstamo para comprar su mercadería. A nivel personal, Marcela quisiera seguir con su negocio, pero adicionalmente tener un negocio estable como una librería en su casa y ya ha empezado con la construcción y ampliación de su casa. Marcela tiene 39 años, una hija de 12 (está estudiando)y otro de 1 año.
Le gusta trabajar con Fondo Esperanza  porque se siente comoda con las demás socias de su Banco Comunal y porque le ayudan con financiamiento para comprar su mercadería.
Marcela esta con polera negra con flores, sentada al medio
texts.en:
The members of "Princesas Guerreras" [Warrior Princesses] sell silver jewelry, cosmetics and perfumes, and bakery products (bread, cakes, sweets and empanadas).

Marcela sells underwear and clothes, mainly in schools. She buys everything in Santiago. Marcela has had this activity for ten years now, and will use this loan to stock her business. On a personal level, Marcela would like to continue with her business, but she also has a stable business at home: a bookstore. She has also started to make some improvements to her house. Marcela is 39 years old, has a 12-year-old daughter that studies and a one-year-old child.

Marcela likes to work with Fondo Esperanza, because she feels comfortable with the rest of the members from the communal bank and because they help her to finance everything she needs for her business.

Marcela is wearing a black blouse with flowers; she is sitting in the middle.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary Luz, de 25 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ever y su pequeño hijo Paúl al que cuida en la casa rústica que heredó hace 5 años. Desde que nació vivió en el campo y aprendió a cuidar y producir la tierra, sus padres campesinos como ella; le enseñaron las técnicas de agricultura y crianza de ganados. “A un inicio solo sembraba diversos alimentos, tuve muchos inconvenientes las cuales me llevaron a ser más precavida ahora siembro en menor cantidad”, afirma. Pues estos fracasos en la agricultura le ayudaron a que hoy en día se dedique a la ganadería sobre todo a la crianza de vacas, posee 9 ejemplares las cuales le proporcionan la leche que necesita para elaborar queso, su principal actividad económica. Comenta que al día elabora 40 moldes del producto lácteo, para vender en las ciudades de Lima y Huancayo, eso le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos. Su deseo para el futuro es aumentar la cantidad de vacas para llegar a producir 300 litros de leche al día y de esa manera podrá comercializar la leche a una de las empresas procesadoras más grande del país, espera lograrlo pues tiene extensas hectáreas de terreno donde siembra pasto para su alimentación. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo otorgado, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Mary Luz, solicita S/.2000 soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de una vaca nueva para aumentar su ganadería
texts.en: Twenty-five year old Mary Luz is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Ever, and young son, Paúl, whom she looks after in a rural house that she inherited five years ago.  Mary Luz has lived in the country since she was born and she learned to look after and work the land, alongside her parents who were also peasant farmers.  Her parents taught her agricultural techniques and how to raise cattle.  "At first I only planted various foods, I had a lot of problems which led me to be more cautious.  Now I only sow a small amount," she says.  These agricultural failings helped her now to work with cattle, particularly raising cows.  She has nine of them, which provide the milk she needs to make cheese, her main work.  She says that she makes 40 units of cheese per day to sell in the cities of Lima and Huancayo.  This helps her to improve her income.  Her wish for the future is to increase the number of cows she has so as to produce 300 litres of milk a day and so be able to sell her milk to one of the country's largest processing businesses.  She hopes to do this as she has a substantial area of grazing land.  This is Mary Luz's first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support provided.  In addition she promises to make her repayments on time.  Mary Luz is applying for 2000 Nuevo Soles, which will be invested in buying a new cow, to increase her cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Aracely Angélica

texts.es:
La señora Aracely vive en la cuidad de Managua actualmente trabaja como secretaria de una institución madre de dos hijos en edad escolar.

Aracely esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel un crédito para invertirlos  una parte del crédito en compra de útiles escolares,  pago de matricula para sus hijos ya que estamos iniciando el año escolar y son gastos necesarios para que sus hijos puedan ir a la escuela.

Doña Aracely se siente agradecida por que con el primer crédito que  se le otorgo a través de ceprodel kiva lo utilizo en la compra de materiales de construcción para su casa. ahora podra enviar a sus hijos a la escuela que es su prioridad.
texts.en:
This member, Mrs. Aracely, lives in the city of Managua and currently works as a secretary in an institution. She is mother to two school-age children.

Aracely is asking Ceprodel and Kiva for a loan to invest in the necessary school expenses for her children who will soon be starting the school year, such as buying school supplies and paying tuition costs.

Aracely is grateful for her first loan, which was granted through Kiva and Ceprodel and used to purchase building materials for her home. Now, she will be able to send her children to school which is her top priority.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Victor Florencio

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y sus playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz y frejoles. Cuando Victor tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música sobre todo música típica ya que es muy bonita, en algunas ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Saltado de Carne”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero a Victor le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Medico Veterinario ya que le gusta mucho el cuidar de los animales.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Victor trabaja en su parcela en la cual sembrado arroz, el trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y sobre todo cuando le toca regar su cultivo se queda hasta 10 horas ya que tiene que verificar que el sembrío este bien regado él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo es honrado.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, así de esta manera el podrá mantener y cuidad su cultivo en buenas condiciones para tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Camana, which is characterized by its warm climate, beautiful beaches and agricultural development, in particular rice and beans. In his free time he enjoys listening to music, especially folk music, and sometimes he enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes - a tasty Peruvian beef stir fry known as 'Saltado de Carne'. Due to limited financial resources Victor has only attended high school, but he would have liked to study to become a Veterinarian because he loves taking care of animals.

Victor is dedicated to his business and works hard growing rice in his field. He normally works about 6 hours a day, and up to 10 hours on days when he needs to water his crops as he must ensure that they are properly watered. He believes that his business is successful because he works very hard and above all he is honest.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their help he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer for rice cultivation. This will help him to care for and maintain his crops, so that they are in a good condition for a plentiful harvest. He will be able to keep fighting to achieve his biggest dream, to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer for rice cultivation, among others

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHANTAL représente le groupe BASNEWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 13mois. Un (01)  va à l’école et elle a trois (03) personnes en charge.
Mme vend de la pâte d’arachide depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.
Elle veut. s’acheter 02 sacs d’arachides
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Chantal is the Basnewende group representative. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 3 children. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest, 13 months. One of her children attends school and she is responsible for 3 people. She has been selling peanut butter for 10 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding villages. Her customers are residents of the neighbourhood. She would like to buy 2 bags of peanuts. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to improve her family's living conditions and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Florita Del Socorro

texts.es: La soñara Florita habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, Soltera, trabajadora ella lucha dia a dia para mantener a su familia, labora como domestica en una casa privada, en la actualidad quiere anexar un cuarto para en su casa para tener mayor privacidad y  mejarar su condiciones, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara los materiales como cemento, Arena, Hierro, Bloques, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado en conjunto con Fondos Kiva
texts.en:
This lady, Florita, lives in Ticuantepe municipality. She is single and works hard every day to support her family. She works as a maid in a private home, and now wants to add a room to her own home to give increase privacy and improve living conditions for her family. 

With the loan she has requested, Florita will purchase construction materials such cement, sand, iron, and bricks. She is grateful to Afodenic for the support she has received in partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 14 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène  Bakhna 14 regroupe 4 femmes et un homme habitant dans  un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale. La présidente, madame Mborélo, mariée et mère de famille fait du commerce de légumes depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter  des légumes entre autres, choux, aubergine, carotte, navet… 
Avec les bénéfices, elle pourra mettre un peu d’argent de coté et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Son seul souhait serait de hisser son activité à un niveau plus haut avec l’appui de l’IMCEC pour le financer.
texts.en: The Djiguène Bakhna 14 loan group gathers together 4 women and one man who live in the same village, located around 22 kilometres from the main town. The group leader, Mborélo, is married and a mother and has been selling vegetables for 10 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables including cabbages, aubergines, carrots and turnips. She will be able to use her profits to build savings and improve her family's nutrition. Her one wish is to raise the level of her business with the financial support of UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es originaria de Estelí, casada y tiene  tres hijos todos mayores y profesionales, la actividad comercial principal es la venta de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijoles, sorgo y también vende otros  productos como es el  bananos.

Este negocio lo empezó con ahorro propio, Mercedes anteriormente trabajaba para el MINSA ya que la profesión de ella es técnica en cardiología de este trabajo surgieron los ahorro que actualmente tiene su pequeño negocio desde hace 14 años.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una señora de buenos valores emprendedora y muy responsable en sus obligaciones.

Con el crédito otorgado lo destinara para la compra de granos básicos: maíz, frijoles y otros productos para sí poder ampliar más su negocio y poder obtener más ganancia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is originally from Estelí, and is married with three children who are now all adult professionals. Her main business is selling staple grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum, and she also sells other products such as bananas.

Mercedes started this business with her own savings 14 years ago. She previously worked for the Ministry of Health as a technologist in the cardiology department, and through this work she managed to save money to start her small business.

She is known for being a lady of strong entrepreneurial values ​​and is very responsible in her duties.

With this loan, Mercedes will purchase basic grain staples such as corn, beans and other products to enable her to further expand her business and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 59 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 59 se compose de 5 femmes qui vivent dans le même village ; ce dernier situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale.
Madame Magatte Fara est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de famille, d’ailleurs sur la photo on la voit porter sur le dos son dernier enfant  âgé de 2 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis 10 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour finir à 20h du soir car elle possède une petite cantine prés de chez elle. Elle appui son mari dans les charges de la maison et aimerait diversifier son activité dans l’avenir.
texts.en: The Djiguène Bakhna 59 loan group is made up of 5 women who live in the same village. The village is located around 22 kilometres from the main town. Magatte Fara is the group leader. She is married and a mother; indeed, in the photo, she is carrying her youngest child on her back, who is 2 years old. She has been selling beauty products for 10 years. She starts her workday at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes work at 8 o'clock at night, as she owns a small stall near her home. She supports her husband with the household expenses and would one day like to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 53 años , es soltera y madre de 4 hijos, ella viven en su propia casa  construida a base de madera al lado de 2 de sus hijos . Teresa se dedica a la venta de comida , todos los días se encarga de preparar las comidas más exquisitas de la región las cuales son ofrecidas al público desde el puesto de venta que se encuentra en su hogar , por esta razón cada mañana se dirige al mercado principal de la ciudad y asi adquirir  los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los platillos . Lleva en este negocio cerca de 5 años y lo hace con ayuda de su nuera. Su trabajo le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos y obtener nuevos clientes que le solicitan siempre innovar su trabajo.Le agrada mucho su labor pues no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y le permite dedicarse al menor de sus hijos , además vende mucho ya que sus clientes están acostumbrados a su buena sazón. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1600 soles para la compra de productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, tubérculos,entre otros, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda seguir trabajando y a su vez se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Teresa, 53, is a single mother of four children, and lives next door to two of them in her own home constructed of wood. She has a business selling food, and on a daily basis she is responsible for preparing the finest food in the region which she offers to the public from a stall in her home. This is why she goes to the market in the main city every morning to acquire the necessary ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Teresa has been in business for about five years, and her daughter helps her out. Her business has increased her income and she has gained new customers, and always needs to innovate her work. She enjoys her work very much because it not too demanding and allows her to focus on her youngest sons. 

Also, Teresa is successful in selling her dishes because her customers have become used to the great taste. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan of 1600 Soles which she will use to purchase wholesale products such as rice, sugar, and tubers, among others. Teresa is grateful to the people who provide the financing she needs to continue her business, and in turn she agrees to comply with the payment schedule in a timely and responsible manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Jorge es originario de la linda ciudad de Estelí, es casado y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar el cual están cursando la secundaria.

Actualmente se desempeña como gestor de cobro de una micro financiera con los ingreso de sus salario aporta para los gasto del hogar y estudio de sus hijos, Jorge se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable honrado y trabajador.

Con el monto financiado Jorge va comprar una motocicleta ya que le urge comprarla para realizar su trabajo ya que se traslada a otras ciudades lejanas del municipio de Esteli. 

Don Jorge manifiesta sentirse alegre y agradecido con kiva y ceprodel ya que con este financiamiento va poder comprar su medio de transporte y así va facilitar realizar su trabajo más rápido y con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is originally from the beautiful city of Estelí. He is married and has two children that attend secondary school.

Jorge works as a collector for a micro finance institution. With his earnings, he helps with the home expenses and his children’s studies. He is known to be a responsible, honest and hardworking person.

With the loan, Jorge will buy a motorcycle, which he urgently needs in order to travel to neighboring cities to perform his job.

Mr. Jorge says that he is happy and wants to thank Kiva and CEPRODEL, since this loan will help him to buy his means of transportation, which will facilitate his job and make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn works hard to support her family. Adelyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.
Adelyn requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.
Adelyn has been in this business for five years now.
In the future, Adelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines.
She is borrowing through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, corn starch, etc. for her bakery.
Ada has had this business for 1 year. 
Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, corn starch, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en:
The Nyuh Gading group has requested their third loan and continues their businesses. This time they plan to manage pigs which can be sold every 3 months.
Kadek will use her loan to purchase 4 local piglets and feed. She also gives the piglets traditional food. She plans to sell them after 3 months and buy new piglets again. The price for local pigs is more stable than the superior piglet right now. She hopes her plan will run smoothly and she will earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 4 local piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a simple fish vendor in the village of Gonzaga. She supports her family with this source of income. With several years as a fish vendor, she can say that it has been a great help in providing for their everyday living. Now, she is seeking additional working capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy fish and shrimp to sell. She is hoping that, through the loan she receives, she can improve her business in order to provide the good living that everyone is aspiring to.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estrellita has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Estrellita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda works hard to support her family. Wenifreda is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Wenifreda requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat.

Wenifreda has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Wenifreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima works hard to support her family. Felicisima is single and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Felicisima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell to customers like clothes, slippers and pants. 

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Felicisima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like clothes, slippers and pants.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 60 years, married with three children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Yolanda has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Yolanda requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  Yolanda has been in this business for 13 years.  In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children currently going to school, Jovita works very hard to provide for them.

Jovita runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Jovita has been in this business for three years.

In the future Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cecilia has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and beauty products for her business.

Cecilia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her beauty salon business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 36 years old, married and has two children who are all in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Hazel has a rope making business in the Philippines.  Hazel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her rope making.  She has been in this business for twenty years.  In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 44 years old and married with three children.

Carmela works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, spices, etc..

Carmela has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.  Carmela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, can goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Jerluette

texts.en:
Jerluette is married and works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jerluette has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.  Jerluette aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn, 43 years old, is married to a carpenter, and is blessed with six children. They are currently residing at the village of Nungnungan. 

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost a year, and earns a net income of PHP 4,000 a month. She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her store.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Myrna

texts.en:
Ma. Myrna is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. Rice farming is their way of living. Ma. Myrna works hard to support her husband in cultivating their farm lot.

As of now, Ma. Myrna needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest. In the future, Ma. Myrna hopes to make their business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 61 Group

texts.fr:
Représenté par la dame Fatou, le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 61, regroupe 5 femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elle habite un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale.
Fatou, mariée, vent des fruits depuis 15 ans, elle l’a démarré très jeune. Chaque matin dès 8h, elle se dirige vers Pout un village situé sur la route qui mène à la capitale pour proposer ses produits aux voyageurs. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des mandarines, clémentines, pastèques et autres fruits de la période. Avec les revenus de son activité, elle appuie son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et réussi même à épargner. Elle envisage de diversifier son activité dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Fatou is the representative of the loan group Djiguène Bakhna 61, which gathers together 5 women who work in retail. She lives in a village located about 22 kilometres from the main town. Fatou is married and has been selling fruit for 15 years; she started at a young age. Every morning at 8 o'clock, she goes to Pout, a village on the road which leads to the capital, to offer her products to travellers. She is requesting this loan to buy mandarins, clementines, melons and other seasonal fruit. She supports her husband with the daily expenses and even manages to save with the revenue generated by her business. In the future, she plans to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 62 Group

texts.fr:
Djiguène Bakhna 62 est un groupe de crédit qui se compose de 5 membres dont un homme et 4 femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce.
Aicha, la présidente, a une expérience de plus de 10 ans ; elle vend des fruits et légumes et des produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est jeune et elle appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison, c’est d’ailleurs pour cette raison qu’elle a fait parti de ce groupe de crédit afin de pouvoir bénéficier de prêt pour renforcer ses activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en: Djiguène Bakhna 62 is a loan group which is made up of 5 members, one man and 4 women, who work in retail. Aicha, the group's leader, has over 10 years worth of experience. She sells fruit and vegetables and beauty products. She is married and a mother. She is young and supports her husband with the household expenses, and it is for this reason that she is a member of this loan group; to be able to benefit from a loan with which to strengthen her revenue-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 42 years old, and a single mother.  She is residing harmoniously together with her parents and daughter in the city of Cauayan.  She has owned and operated a grocery store for almost 24 years, earning a net income of PHP 24,000 a month. 

She would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase sugar, milk, canned goods, beverages, and cooking oil.  She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted to gain more income and to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, milk, canned goods, beverages, and cooking oil

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business retailing firewood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for twenty years. Elvira earns additional income from food-vending.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 56 years old and married with three children.

Elma works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, shampoo, etc..

Elma has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut shell and rice.  Elma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38-years-old and married with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from rope making.  Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 60 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land. His wife has a position as a book-keeper at a business entity. His elder daughter works as a distributor at an organization which administers the water supply; she is now on maternity leave. His younger daughter works as a bar-keeper in a private business entity. He himself is retired from work and gets a state pension. In retirement, he began transporting his daughter's children to their school and kindergarten. 

In the near future, he wants to build his own house on his land. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase fiber glass, cement and bricks. During this period of the year, the price of building materials reaches its lowest rate and it will save him quite a lot of money. Using his savings, he has already purchased foam substances and other materials. As spring approaches, he will begin construction work on his house. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future for the sake of his children. Building a high-quality house has several advantages, namely it will reduce the usage of coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution and will provide better living conditions for the family etc.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and fiberglass.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is married with two children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Genelyn is 38 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Genelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Genelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Genelyn has been in this business for 21 years.  In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.fr: Francis est une jeune Camerounais âgé de 28 ans, fiancé et père de 04 enfants dont l'age varie entre 07 mois et 06 ans et parmi lesquels 02 vont à l'école. comme activité, il dispose d'un atelier de soudure métallique dans un quartier de la ville depuis 08 ans. il bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter acheter de la ferraille et du fer à soudure pour la fabrication des pressoirs qu'il va revendre par la suite. il compte réinvestir les revenus générés dans son activité afin de la faire grandir car il a pour ambition d'avoir un grand atelier de soudure
texts.en: Francis is a young 28 year old Cameroonian, engaged to be married and the father of four children between the ages of 7 months and 6 years, 2 of whom attend school. He has had a metal welding workshop for the past 8 years in a neighborhood of the city, and has acquired solid knowledge about this line of work. He would like to use this loan to purchase more raw materials (iron and scrap iron) to make presses that he will then sell. He plans to reinvest the profits from this activty in the business in order to continue its expansion.

loans.use: purchase raw materials

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 63 Group

texts.fr:
Djiguène Bakhna 63 regroupe aussi cinq femmes qui se sont unis par voisinage : elles logent toute dans le même village. Khardiata, la présidente fait de la vente de légumes depuis plus de 10 ans.
