She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ada is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables for resale in her business.

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Eva is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like eggs, canned goods, biscuits, soap, etc. for her general store.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities with her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like eggs, canned goods, biscuits, soap, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Manalo with her spouse and child. She is raising hogs for future sale, this is her income. She usually earns PHP 1,000 for each hog sold. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7000 to buy medicines and hog feed for sustainability. It will help nourish the hogs and achieve good growth.

Grace would like to keep improving her sales and save profits for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy medicines and hog feed for sustainbility.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn raises hogs and re-sells them for a proift to cover school fees for her children who are in their elementary grades. Jenalyn is 30 years old, married and has three children. She also has a small store. Jenalyn wants to keep diversifying her business that is why she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs. 

In the future, Jenalyn would like to keep earning good income and saving funds for the education of her children which leads to a better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is married and lives with his family, he is managing his butcher’s shop that he contracted to earn his own income. From a very young age, he had to work hard and the business is growing thanks to all of his hard work and sacrifice.

Omar has a good customer base because he is a good butcher and always offers good customer service. Due to the work that he is doing, he has enough income to help his family have a better quality of life.

Omar needs the loan to buy two cows to keep working and offering a good variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a video camera for movie making services

loans.name: Dhamiri

texts.en:
Dhamiri, from Msambweni, is a divorced woman with no children.

She is a hairdresser. She explains that she has loyal customers because she always provides good service. She is a hardworking person, responsible and very honest. Her dream has always been to become a professional and to have her own salon. With time, sacrifice and hard work, she was able to reach her goal.

She is now requesting a loan to expand her beauty salon. In this way, she expects to be able to continue to grow her business and to offer better services to her customers.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

Analyn has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains for resale.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod is a hardworking and kind man. He is a master at repairing mobile phones. He has been busy with this work for more than three years. 

He is married but has no children yet. His wife is a student, and she studies very well. He must pay for his wife’s tuition, but his income from his work is small. His wife every day asks him for 500 US dollars, but Dilshod does not have the money. 

Dilshod is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars to pay for his wife’s tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's tuition.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 31 años de edad,  el vive en el distrito de San Jose de Los Molinos, Ica, Perú.- el distrito de San Jose se caracteriza por el desarrollo de la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de algodón, papa, maíz, cebolla, entre otros. Desde muy joven Luis aprendió a realizar reparaciones para automóviles, y empezó a trabajar en un pequeño taller, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, debido a ello solo estudio hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de ingeniería mecánica.

Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Luis logro tener su negocio de reparación de automóviles, especialmente reparación de llantas, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 3 clientes diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo realiza un buen trabajo.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una compresora nueva para su trabajo ya que la que tiene actualmente se encuentra en mal estado ya que es muy viejita y gasta mucho en repararla; así el podrá tener una herramienta adecuada para su trabajo y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y un taller mas grande”.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, lives in the district of San Jose de los Molinos, Ica, Peru. The San Jose area is characterised by the development of agriculture, particularly growing cotton, potato, corn, onion, amongst other things. From a young age Luis learned to repair cars and started to work in a little workshop, as his parents had very little money. Because of this he only studied to 5th grade, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering.

After a lot of effort and saving, Luis managed to get his own business repairing cars, specialising in tyre repairs. Her works around 9 hours a day and serves up to three customers a day. He believes that his business is going well because he is friendly and above all because he does a good job.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as it is thanks to them that he will be able to buy a new moulder for his work as his current one is in a poor state as it is very old and very expensive to repair. This will let him have a tool that is adequate for his work and he will be able to continue working to make his greatest dream "to have his own home and a bigger workshop" a reality

loans.use: to buy a moulder.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 23 years old, married and has a child. To acquire income, she raises hogs and re-sells them for a profit. She has been doing this for over a year now and earns about P2,000 for each hog. She wants to buy another hog and its feed so she will make more profit in her small business. She is asking for P9,000 to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustainability. She promises to pay back her loan in full and keep improving her business to save funds for education and emergency purposes of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Perusi's Group

texts.en:
Perusi's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Perusi is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Perusi has been working hard to manage her food-related business; specifically, she buys and sells maize and rice.

To help expand her business, Perusi has requested a loan in the amount of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain additional inventory, such as dry beans and maize flour, to sell. Perusi feels that the loan will enable her to generate an increase in profits and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Perusi hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase even more inventory.

Perusi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to obtain additional stocks of food items, such as dry beans and maize flour, for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 31-year-old married man with two children.

To earn a living, he runs a motorcycle (locally known as boda-boda) transportation business, but he also operates an agro-vet chemicals' shop. He has been in these businesses for three years and earns a monthly income of approximately $10,000 KES from both businesses.

He is seeking his second loan, this time in the amount of 25,000 KES. He intends to use the loan proceeds to service his motorcycle and to buy more assorted chemicals and animal feed for sale in his shop. With the profits that he expects to earn as a result of the loan, he plans to purchase more inventory for his sales business.

In the future, he wants to be able to expand his shop into a wholesale sales operation. His dream is to expand his business to other towns and to provide his children with the best possible education.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and to purchase additional assorted chemicals and animal feed for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a  business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional  rice to sell in her rice business.  Lenita has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from raising chickens.

Lenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to pay for the college education of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gerlie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Gerlie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a 27-year-old, married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three young children. The eldest is seven and the youngest is one year old. 

She has engaged in the motorcycle transportation business for eight years now. She earns PHP 5,000 per month. This is the source of her income to meet the other needs of her family.
 
Genelyn is requesting a loan to buy wheels, interiors, and chains. These are some parts of the motorcycle. Through this loan, she will be able to buy this equipment and change the old parts, so that her motorcycle will be in good condition. 

In the future, Genelyn hopes to expand her business. She wants to raise her children and send them in school.

loans.use: to buy parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a very hard-working and determined lady. She has been blessed with three children. She runs a cereal shop and has been in business for the past ten years. She used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has increased her cereals stock and has managed to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her cereal business. She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is a hog raiser at Amulung. He is 40 years old and married to Marilou. They have six children. Upon selling the raised hogs, he is able to earn P2,000 for each hog. He hopes to keep ensuring healthy growth of his hogs and is in need of enough feed and medicines. For this reason, he is asking for P6,000 to buy feed and medicines for use in his hog-raising business. Noel would like to keep earning good profits to give the best education to all his children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for use in his hog-raising business

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 41 years old and lives with his wife, Ekaterine, and their retired parents in the Kvareli district.

Zaza is a farmer, while Ekaterine is a housewife. The family owns a plot of land, where they grow watermelon and grapes, and they sell the harvested products at the local market. On several occasions, Zaza has requested a loan from local financial institutions for an agricultural start-up business, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his low income and his lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. Zaza’s loan request was, however, approved by the Kiva and Credo loan program. The loan program provides businesses with start-up funding to assist the country's rural poor, who do not have access to most credit products as they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low incomes.

With the loan proceeds, Zaza would like to purchase a tractor. The tractor would be used to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly during tilling and sowing seasons, which would allow Zaza to earn money from those farmers. Zaza plans on saving any profits generated as a result of the loan and tractor and will continue to cultivate his family's own land.

Another portion of the loan proceeds would be used for buying a milk cow, which would be used to produce milk products. They plan on selling their dairy products at the local market and to thereby increase the family's monthly income. Any profits generated will be reinvested in the dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor and a milk cow

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak and his wife are engaged in land cultivation. In their own greenhouse, they plant various kinds of vegetables, such as tomatoes, peppers, and cucumbers, and sell them in the Ararat region markets. The revenue they use to sustain their large family. 

Sahak has four children: two sons and two daughters. His mother, who is retiree, also lives with them. Sahak is 35 years old and lives with his family in one of the villages of Ararat region. 

More than five years ago, Sahak used to work as a builder. But, since 2010, he runs his own family agricultural business. He is satisfied with this activity and hopes to enlarge it in the future. Land cultivation is a hard business, but at the same time, more profitable. Sahak and his wife do their best to build a good future for their children. 

Sahak asks from Kiva lenders a USD 2,500 loan which will help him to repair their greenhouse in order to be able to plant the vegetables at the appropriate time.

loans.use: to repair his greenhouse in order to be able to plant the vegetables at the appropriate time.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is a forty-six-year-old married man with four children living in Hioma, Uganda. He has a poultry project, where he rears broilers and layers. He also gets additional income from his salary and farming. 

As a good father, he desires to educate his children up to university level, and to set up sustainable income generating activities such as rental houses.  High cost of feeds and limited capital affect his business profits,  but his desire is to own at least 10,000 birds by the end of the year.

Ignatius intends to use the loan to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Lhea

texts.en:
Lhea works hard to support her family. Lhea is married and has a dried fish-selling business in the Philippines.

Lhea requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Lhea has been in this business for 13 years now. She earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Lhea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business recycling materials in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy used cartoons and sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy used cartoons and sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha lives in Msambweni and is married with six children. She is dedicated to her business, operating rental houses. Having a good quantity of clients has helped her to increase her income and thanks to this, she has now been able to work toward her aspiration of building a house.

She has received a loan from Yehu Microfinance that she has used for the construction of her house and this loan that she is now requesting will also go towards finishing the construction.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for construction of her house.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 27 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Grace has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 63-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. In order to provide for his family, he bought land and started farming. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and expand his farming activities. He has now ventured into poultry farming after assessing a ready market in restaurants and retail shops where he would be assured of a sustainable demand for eggs all year round. Seasonal weather changes affect the business while his dream is to own a big poultry project. Bernard intends to use the loan to buy chicks to sell.

loans.use: to  buy chicks to sell.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is 21 years old. He is very smart and a clever boy. He was one of the best pupils at the school and graduated school with excellent marks. He is a first year student at the medical college now. His manages with education very well. He likes all subjects which they learn at the college. His friends love him because he is true person. 

Alijon is not married yet and lives with parents. His father is a businessman. He has been busy with animal husbandry but his income is not enough to pay for his son’s education at the college. Alijon is asking for a loan to pay his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Muche

texts.en:
Muche is a 51-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 9 to 22 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a food stall where she sells coconuts. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Muche describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of coconuts to sell. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy coconuts to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of coconuts. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 10,000 which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works very hard to provide for her family. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, detergent, diapers, and other miscellaneous items. Elsie has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of five. She runs a salon as well as a cosmetic shop, and this has been her income-generating business for the last seven years, providing her with an average monthly income of KES 18,000. This loan of KES 20,000 is her first loan from KADET LTD. With this loan, she intends to buy a larger stock of cosmetic items, as well as braids and hair weaves, to use in her salon. She anticipates earning profits, which she will use in part to pay school fees for her children, with the surplus being used to expand her business. Lucy hopes to improve her standard of living and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of cosmetic items, as well as braids and hair weaves, for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in the transport business and has grown his business over time. Yusuf started as a hired driver, and saved up to buy a lorry. The business has become very lucrative since many farmers require his services to transport produce to markets. High fuel costs and bad roads affect his profits, and his desire is to someday own another lorry. Yusuf intends to use the loan to repair his lorry.

loans.use: to repair his lorry.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. She has been in the food vending business for 21 years now.

Nelda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business. She has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Nelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to finish her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luz successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Luz's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 35-year-old married man with three children living Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns rental houses where he collects a monthly rent and he also drives a taxi to earn extra income. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university. Bad weather and roads and failure of tenants to remit money on time affect his business while his dream is to own a housing estate. Samuel intends to use the loan to construct toilets for his tenants.

loans.use: to construct toilets for tenants.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu sells a variety of products. Managing her business involves offering merchandise and accepting, over a short or long term, payments  which she collects each day. This type of work allows her to provide jobs to other people since she has many customers.


Mwanaulu is an entrepreneur who seeks to improve stability for her family day after day. Her objective going forward is to buy products for delivering her merchandise. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of products to sell. This will enable her to continue working and selling all types of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is a 48-year-old married woman from Alicia, Bohol. She has four children. The eldest is 16 and the youngest is 8 years old. She has been engaged in a food vending business for 20 years now as well as a motorcycle transportation business as her second business. She sells cooked food in her local community. This is the source of her income  for the needs of the family. 

Gliceria is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and pork. These are the ingredients in her food vending business. Through this loan, she will be able to buy more of these ingredients so she can start cooking and selling them.

In the future, Gliceria hopes to expand her business. She wants to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and pork

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the htings she needed for her farm. She has been in this business for twenty years. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their every-day expenses. She would like to apply for a new loan of PHP 25,000. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials, such as wire and baskets, as well as supplies, such as seed and fertilizer, for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Bella simply dreams of having a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories about her life and her business every week, and to  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a 30 year old man from Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. He has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 12 years. He sells a variety of  items and goods to the people in the neighborhood. Rene is applying for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, chips and biscuits, candies, noodles and soda. With this loan, he will be able to sell more and increase his profits. In the future, Rene dreams of expanding his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in his sari-sari (variety) store, such as canned goods, chips and biscuits, candies, noodles and soda.

loans.name: J.j Group

texts.en: JJ group consists of two members, both from Camara in Dansoman. They are Joana and Janet, who sell eggs. They have been together since 2012. Joana, a 45-year-old, is married to Jonathan, a 51-year-old tailor. They are blessed with three children. She needs a loan of GHS 700 to buy more eggs to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for the past four years and is doing very well. She has been very loyal and honest with ID Ghana and is now applying for her second loan, to meet her customers’ demand.  The group needs a total of GHS 1,400 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demands of their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more crates of eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 40 years old, married, and has five children. With two of the children currently going in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them. Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including noodles, eggs, canned goods and spices. Merlita has been in this business for a year. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including noodles, eggs, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 8 to 16 years. She describes herself as a reliable woman. 

Fatuma operates a retail business where she sells water and clothes material. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from customers. She will use the loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy clothes material to sell. Her business goal is to run a small boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a loan of 20,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes material to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
This is Catalina. She previously received a loan for 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Catalina would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Catalina hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: gardening materials, wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Ubay, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. This has been the source of their income. Rose is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for their fishing boat.

In the future, Rose has hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of their children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new engine for their fishing boat

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
This is Aurelia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Aurelia hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and materials needed in her farming business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Msambweni neighborhood in her own house. She is divorced. 

She has had a small grocery store and vegetable shop in her house for two years. This way she helps her family get ahead. Later on she wants to expand it and be able to offer a greater variety of products.

She requested the loan to buy candy as her place is in front of a school in the area. She will also buy drinks, dairy products, and baked goods, among others.

loans.use: to buy candy and drinks, dairy products, and baked goods, among other items.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Olivia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Olivia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 41-year-old businessman. He is married to Faith, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. Simon has been working in the quarry business for the past ten years with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which he uses to support the family.  

Simon is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy modern mining equipment. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to send his children to the best school, where they can have access to high standards of education.

loans.use: to buy modern mining equipment.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling fruit, and has been in this business for ten years. She also generates additional income through selling beer and local brew. She works from her home and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis, seven days a week. Her major business challenge includes transportation and seasonality. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

Angella has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of cabbages, mangoes, oranges, and pineapples. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start growing some of the fruits herself.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fruits like mangoes, pineapples, oranges, and passion fruit.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Purita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the retail of gasoline and farming rice. Purita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her sales business.

Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Hoima, Uganda. For the past year, he has run a shop where he sells mainly clothes and other general merchandise. He started this business using capital from his savings from farming activities. His major business challenge is inadequate capital and stiff competition, while his dream is to educate his children up to University. He intends to diversify his business and trade in produce since there is a lot of demand from schools and prisons. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy clothes and general merchandise such as soap and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and general merchandise such as soap and beans to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 44-year-old, single woman. She lives in a small home, with her mother. Hana has a sewing workshop in Jinen, which has been a profitable project.

Hana is requesting a 1,000 USD family loan from FATEN. She will use the loan funds to help her cover the cost of purchasing an additional sewing machine. This purchase will enable her to provide better quality service to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Hana's income. She appears in her workshop, in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 43 years of age, is married to a farmer and has been blessed with four children. She manages a small-scale vegetable plantation business. She has done this work for almost 26 years. She earns a net income of PHP 8,000 every harvest season. In this business, she harvests some vegetables twice a year, such as squash, eggplant, string beans, root crops and tomatoes.

She would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable plantation. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 53 years old.  She is married and has seven children, one of whom attends school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Edna has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Edna has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other fishing paraphernalia.  Edna has been in this business for 30 years.  

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing paraphernalia.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, tiene 44 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos quienes ya son independientes, vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Doña Reyna tiene 3 años de dedicarse al comercio con la venta de ropa nueva y usada, vende cortinas, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, sabanas, edredones y otros. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar ropa variada para vender. Con este préstamo va surtir más el negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su plan es seguir trabajando con el negocio para hacerlo crecer y de las ganancias poder hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Reyna, 44, is married and has 3 children who are already independent.  She lives in a town in the municipality of Tela, in the department of Atlantida.  Reyna has been selling used and new clothing for 3 years.  She sells women's, men's and children's clothing, curtains, bed sheets, comforters, and other items.  She sells from place to place, and also by orders.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Honduran lempiras that she will use to buy a variety of clothing to sell.  With this loan, she will stock up her business so that she can have more products to offer to her customers.  Her plan is to continue to work and make the business grow, so that from the earnings she can make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She grows and sells ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the gardening materials she needed at that time, for her business. She started this business 20 years ago, and it is continuously growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials that she needs now for her business, like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. Her profits from this business will definitely help her provide for their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nida dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will have good jobs. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Santanina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Santanina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Santanina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy stock for her general store, like sugar, oil, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell in her general store, like sugar, oil, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 38-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 5 and 10 years. He describes himself to be a focused and self-driven man. 

Wilson operates a motorcycle to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. 

Wilson will use the 50,000 Kenya shillings loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his transportation business. This is Wilson’s second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Hermenigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is a 54-year-old, married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has five grown children. She has engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for 30 years. This is the source of her income.

Herminigilda is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, fish hooks, and nylon string. These will be used in catching fish. Through this loan, she will be able to buy these materials that are needed in her boat and for catching fish. Herminigilda hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish hooks, and nylon string

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar has expanded his business and opened up a food cafeteria in Vikwatani, Mombasa, which is his second business for additional income. He is doing great and he has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop. 

He hopes to create awareness among people who do not yet know about borrowing, encouraging them to join KADET, which he believes will help them grow economically and not depend on handouts.

loans.use: to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is 32 years old and married with five children.

Vina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice-selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Vina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for eight years and also earns an income from retailing rice.

Vina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old and married with two children. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emily has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, diapers, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Emily would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a 54-year-old woman. She is a mother of four children. Her husband and eldest son work in a hotel. Their income is insufficient to pay for their household expenses. She is an excellent embroiderer. She provides embroidery services in her community and sometimes sells her excellent work in the main market. By doing so, she gets a good amount of profit. Currently, she doesn't have enough embroidery materials to continue her business. Therefore, as a member of an eight-person group, Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, Shameem will purchase a variety of embroidery materials including needles, threads in a variety of colours, clothing, etc. This will help her to continue her business as well as to increase her net sales and income.

She dreams of providing quality education for her children.

Note: In the picture, Shameem is the one who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of embroidery materials including needles, threads in a variety of colours, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a 52-year-old woman and is engaged in a fishing business. She owns a fishing boat, and she has been engaged in this venture for more than 20 years.

Rosenda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. With this equipment, she will be able to improve her fishing business and the quantity of fish that her men will catch.

Rosenda hopes to make her business a success, and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 14 years and 21 years old. She describes herself as a self-driven and business-oriented woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as flour, sugar, salt, maize flour, soda, bread, tea leaves, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Zipporah will use this 90,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to be a distributor within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run the leading profitable distributor business in her hometown. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay her previous loans of 20,000 KES and 50,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Desebel

texts.en: Desebel is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Desebel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Desebel has been in her business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, Desebel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells soft drinks in Soba, Hohoe, but took out a loan to start palm oil production. Cecilia has received an education up to middle school level. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a peasant farmer. Cecilia has been selling soft drinks in her community, Soba, for the past 14 years. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits, so she can make more profit for her business. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to enable her to get a bigger amount of working capital.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is 28 years old and lives in Ijevan town with her brother. She studies at Yerevan State University in Ijevan in the Faculty of Mathematics and Mechanics. Together with her studies, Armenuhi works at a local store as a seller where she trades clothing. She works hard to sustain her and her brother's living. But, unfortunately, her monthly income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, and it is very difficult for Armenuhi to save money for her education. She has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. This will help her to complete her education and become a good specialist. Armenuhi dreams of having a good job and improving her and her brother's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a tailoring store and sells clothes that she makes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a local residential area, and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Joy will use this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy clothes materials for making new clothes to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making new clothes to sell

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Сафарбек проживает в районе Яван. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. Живет вместе с женой и родителями. Сафарбек очень трудолюбивый человек. Он вместе с отцом занимается купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Сафарбек запрашивает кредит для закупа телят, коз и овец. Он намерен заняться разведением мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота. За счет полученной прибыли Сафарбек хочет увеличить поголовья скота и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Safarbeck lives in the Yavan district of Tajikistan.  He is 27 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and his parents.  He is a very hardworking man who buys and sells cattle with his father.  He is requesting a loan to buy some calves, goats and sheep.  He wants to raise both small livestock and cattle.  Safarbeck plans to use his profits to increase his herd and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy calves, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a fisherman from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. He is married and has children, and fishing is the main way to earn a living in his area.

Ruel needs a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat. He believes that this loan could help him improve his fishing business and increase his income. In the future, he dreams of making his business sustainable and productive. Moreover, he wants to save money for his children's future schooling and to pay off his loan.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is re-listing Nelia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old, married and has five children.  

Erlinda is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 26,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and buy additional fertilizers for her business.

Erlinda has been farming sugarcane for eight years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and buy additional fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Любящая мама Ханифа, несмотря на свои годы трудиться, и делает всё для своих детей.  К великому сожалению ее муж  умер   несколько лет тому назад оставив её одну с четырьмя детьми. С того дня на Ханифе возлагалось  огромная обязанность,  она была  главой семьи и  покровителем детей. Наряду с воспитанием детей ей нужно было прокормить и спасти свою семью от бедности. Она работала и трудилась, находила источники доходов и таким образом как то встала на ноги. Для осуществления своих целей не раз обращалась  за кредитом в МДО «Арванд». Её своевременное погашение доказывает, что Ханифа ответственная женщина и заботливая мама. Пользуясь  кредитом, она смогла создать условие проживания для своих детей. Постепенно работая и накопив денег, решила открыть свой маленький бизнес. Год назад взяла в аренду магазин и начала продавать всякие мелочи для повседневной жизни. Постепенно расширяясь, привозила хоз товары. Запрос на её товары начали расти, покупатели заказывали привести нужные им вещи. На сегодняшней день у неё на прилавке имеется всё – от спичек до наборов для кухни и одеяло.  В целях расширения и закупа новых товаров Ханифа обратилась за очередным кредитом. Она очень надеется на помощь и  содействие со стороны организации Арванд в её развитие маленького бизнеса и на этот раз. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и  за доверие.  Ханифа очень верит, что их детей ждёт хорошее будущее, и они смогут стать достойными имени своего отца и опорой своей матери в старости лет.
texts.en:
This is Hanifa, a loving mother who, in spite of her age, is still working hard and doing everything she can for her children.  Her husband unfortunately died a few years ago, leaving her alone with four children.  Since that day, she has had to assume a huge responsibility as the head of her family and the protector of her children.  Besides raising her children, she has had to provide them with food and keep them away from poverty.  

Hanifa worked very hard and was able to find sources of income which allowed her to stand on her feet.  In order to reach her goals, she turned to the organization MDO Arvand and applied for loans more than once.  She repaid these loans on time, which clearly shows that she is a responsible woman and a caring mother.  Thanks to the loans she took, she was able to create adequate living conditions for her children.  

Having worked and saved money for some time, she decided to open a small business.  Last year she rented a store and started to sell small everyday items.  She gradually expanded her business, and also started to sell household goods.  The demand for her goods began to increase, and she received orders from her customers to purchase other necessary items.  Today, Hanifa's store contains everything, from matches to kitchen utensils and blankets.

In order to further expand her business and to buy more merchandise, Hanifa is requesting a new loan.  This time again, she truly hopes to receive help and assistance from MDO Arvand, in order to further develop her small business.  She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support and their trust.  She strongly believes that a brighter future awaits her children and that they will be worthy of their father's name and of the support their mother has given them in her late years.

loans.use: to purchase household goods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a small trader in Soba, Hohoe community. She has received education only to the middle school level.  She is a widow and has 4 children. 

Theresa explained that her working capital was not enough to acquire more products, so she decided to take out a loan so she could produce palm oil which is on high demand now and will enable her make some money. 

Theresa has been in the small trading business for the past 7 years. Since she is a widow and receives no help financially from anyone else, she is responsible for all the financial needs of her children and herself. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits and increase her working capital for her trading business. She hopes to save her new profits from her businesses and put it towards her children's education.

loans.use: buy palm fruits and increase working capital

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  is married and has seven children, two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Teopista  has a business of a market stall and has been in this business for 13 years.   She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, Irish potatoes and cassavas to sell. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.  Her major business challenge   includes seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler.  

Teopista resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed inputs for her garden. This has been her business for fifteen years now. She is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday needs.

Marilyn would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn dreams that her business will grow and expand. She also wants to help her family financially. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: buy gardening inputs

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is re-listing Virginia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a seamstress in Soba, a community in Hohoe. Irene has received education only to the middle school level.  She is divorced and has one child. 

Irene has been a seamstress for the past 9 years. She is responsible for her own general upkeep and that of her child. Her loan will be used to buy sewing threads, linen in bulk and other supplies necessary to run her seamstress business. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop to work and sell from.

loans.use: buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is 50 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Camila works very hard to provide for them.

Camila runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store,  like canned goods, soap, noodles, coffee, etc.  She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Camila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She is married and they have five children who attend school and are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Mwanajuma has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

Mwanajuma is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products to be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has 5 children. She has received schooling but only through the middle school level.  

Christine is a food vendor at Soba, Hohoe, and has done this work since 2008. She also sells kenkey in Soba, Hohoe, which she has done for 3 years now. Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian meal which is produced by cooking fermented corn dough wrapped in maize husk and steamed. Kenkey can be eaten hot or cold with various kinds of sauces such as pepper and tomato sauce. This traditional dish is often served either with meat or fish such as fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, and roasted turkey. 

Christine's husband is a farmer in their community.  Christine uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family.  She will use the loan to purchase a large bag of maize, and use part for the preparation of her kenkey dish and another part will expand her food production into making corn porridge for breakfast, another local favorite in her community. Through this expansion of her food selling business Christine hopes to generate additional income to further expand her food businesses. In addition, with the new profits from her expanded business, Christine plans to save for her old age.

loans.use: buy maize to make food for sale

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a 37-year-old married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sheryl has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Sheryl requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, t-shirts, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Sheryl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sheryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, t-shirts, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a 13,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-production business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 22-year-old married man. He describes himself as an energetic and humble man. He operates a retail business selling khat (a plant containing a stimulant). He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a market with a lot of potential, and his primary customers are local residents and customers from the neighboring country. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more khat to sell. His business goal is to buy a car within 5 years to help in transporting the khat to customers. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy khat to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be an energetic and focused man.

Jacob operates a retail business where he sells khat. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a potential business environment with a high demand of khat and his primary customers are people from neighboring country and local residents.   He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Jacob will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy khat to sell.  His business goal is to be the best supplier of khat  within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy khat to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is married and a mother of four children. Beverly is 34 years old and resides in Aurora in the province of Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, Beverly operates a manufacturing business specialized in decoration-making. Beverly sells her products to the tourists and to the local community members, and this product is for export. It is used for decoration. 

In the photo, the items beside Beverly are not yet finished products. They have to be colored or beautified before Beverly brings them to the market or before she sells them. The items are made of lampakanat, a semi-aquatic herb that can be taken by the roadside of the fish pond. This is a roll of string. Beverly has been in this industry for three years. Each month, she earns 3,150 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. 

Beverly has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase decoration-making items such as coloring materials (varnish). Beverly has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Beverly wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase decoration-making items such as coloring materials (varnish).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for monthly academic installments

loans.name: Njilu

texts.en:
Njilu is a 34-year-old married man. He has one child who is 8 years old. He describes himself to be a God-fearing, focused and optimistic man. He operates a retail business where he sells khat. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a viable business location with high demand for khat, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy khat to sell. His business goal is to increase operating capital to 150,000 KES within five years. In addition, Njilu does several other business that increase his business income. He sells chickens and milk, and he is also a priest in his church. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy khat to sell.

loans.name: Mwanavua

texts.en:
Mwanavua has been married for many years. They have five children who attend school. Mwanavua has her own business that she has acquired with a lot of effort. She told us that she has a well-stocked food stall that she works in every day, and through this, she helps her family. Thanks to the work that she and her husband are doing, they are educating their children and they buy all of the necessities for their home. 

She seeks this loan to buy drinks, dairy items, meat and additional supplies to be able to continue working and meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy items, meat and additional supplies.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

She has a business of selling yellow bananas and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She generates additional income through selling onions and tomatoes and from rental rooms. She works from her home seven days out of every week and sells both on a retail and a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university and also to sell on a wholesale basis only.  

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita is 41 years old and married with 10 children. With five children in school, Gelita works very hard to provide for them.

Gelita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, noodles, spices, etc.

Gelita has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Gelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is from Likoni, Mombasa. She makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. She is married; her husband is also a businessman who sells spare auto parts. Mesalimu and her husband live together in their own house along with their six children. Mesalimu is a very hardworking woman with very good references. She has been working in this business for four years.

Mesalimu is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing, since she wants to offer a better variety of clothing to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Humayro

texts.en:
Humayro is 32 years old. She is a very sociable and hardworking woman. Humayro is married and has four children. She wants to organize her own business, as her husband’s income from growing agricultural products is not enough. Humayro decided to organize a business with animal husbandry, as this kind of business has great demand in the local market. She is sure that her business will go well because she studied at the course of ‘To get ahead’ from a woman's organization and gained enough business skills. 

Humayro will buy cattle, care for them for some months, and then resell them to the local market. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy three cows to organize her new business. She awaits your support. This loan will help her to organize her own business and in this way to improve her living conditions. 

Humayro awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy three cows for her new business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is from Likoni, Mombasa. She is married and works as a merchant. Mwanajuma is the owner of a store where she's been working for three years. She says that she's making headway with the business, because she's attracted a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

Mwanajuma is requesting a loan to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 43 years old and married with five children.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from an e-loading and gasoline retail businesses.

Roselyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the costs of completing his home, so he can marry and have a place to live with his bride.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en: Celestine has been selling fried fish for the past 3 years now, in her community Soba Hohoe. Celestine received education through a junior high school level. She is married and has 6 children with her husband who is a farmer in their community. Celestine helps her husband care for their children. Her loan will be used to buy large cartons of fresh fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a refrigerator to be able to store and buy fish in larger quantities and sell in the neighboring communities.

loans.use: to buy large cartons of fresh fish.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is married and has two children. Previously she was a mobile vendor of food stuff. With great effort she was able to open her own shop, which currently has numerous customers in the area.

Mesaidi attends her shop while her husband dedicates himself to his business. Both are making great efforts to get ahead and to help their children, since they want them to finish their studies and become successful people.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods and other basic products. She is grateful for this opportunity which she is receiving, since it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods and other basic products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has 3 children. She has never attended school. Margaret sells ladies sandals in Soba, Hohoe, which she has done since 2007. Margaret recently decided to sells bowls in addition to her sandals to get extra income to support her husband who is a farmer. Margaret uses her income to assist her husband pay for their children school fees and the general family upkeep. Margaret will use the loan to purchase more bowls and also introduce the sale of children’s sandal so that she makes an even larger profit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and also introduce the sale of children’s sandals.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She is single and has six children for who she strives tirelessly to provide a life of dignity that’s free from want. She owns a well-stocked grocery store in Likoni where she’s worked with her family for more than 10 years.

Mwarabu is asking for the loan to buy bulk grains, soft-drinks, meat, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies to keep the store well-stocked. She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because thanks to it she will be able to stay in business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, soft-drinks, meat, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than two years, so she already has some good experience. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Mwanajuma is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Aunty Mercy Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 4 members, Mercy, Janet, Jonse and Sarah. They sell provisions, plantain, palm oil, and cosmetics respectively.

Mercy is a 63 years old provision seller (Milk, Milo, sugar, rice, biscuits, canned tomatoes and other canned products). She is married to Emmanuel who is 66 years old. She has been doing this business for 6 years now. She buys from a market in the capital and sells in the Dansoman community.

This is her 3rd loan with ID Ghana and she needs a loan of GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to her customers.
The entire group needs an amount of GHS 2,550 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more provisions like milk, Milo, sugar, rice, biscuits, canned tomatoes and other canned products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling popcorn. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more maize for making popcorn. She generates additional income through selling charcoal and chicken. She works at the market and has been in this business for five years and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to open up another branch selling popcorn. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more maize for making popcorn.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is 38 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Jovita used her last loan to buy new items to expand her inventory. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of PHP 40,000. This is her 12th loan taken from GDMPC, and will be used to purchase a refrigerator for her soft-drinks and ice candy making. Her business runs well and has a healthy earning in which she is able to save portion. She hopes that her business will flourish more and more.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Фотима обратилась в организацию Арванд для получения кредита.  Она добрая и ответственная  женщина в возрасте 42 лет.  Замужем, имеет троих детей.  У Фотимы и ее мужа нету высшего образования поэтому   они всей семьей занимаются откормом скота. У них в наличии имеется 10 голов крупно  рогатого  скота.   Это их единственный доход в семье и очень приемлемый. Этим видом деятельности Фотима научилась от своих родителей.   Каждую неделю ее муж выводит откормленных скотов на рынок и продает и сразу же покупает молодых телят. Фотима старается  развивать этот бизнес. Она очень долгое время мечтала отремонтировать свой дом так как они живут в очень плохих условиях. Надеется  накопить денег и этим летом создать хорошие условия проживания  для своих детей.
